original: @287a rgya gar skad du /
analyzed: @287a rgya gar skad du /
translated: In Sanskrit:

original: a'a rya ma h'a badzra me ru shi kha ra k'u ta g'a ra dh'a ra ni /
analyzed: a'a rya ma h'a badzra me ru shi kha ra k'u ta g'a ra dh'a ra ni /
translated: Ārya-mahāvajrameruśikharakūṭāgāradhāraṇī

original: bod skad du /
analyzed: bod skad du /
translated: In Tibetan:

original: 'phags pa rdo rje'i ri rab chen po'i rtse mo'i khang pa brtsegs pa'i gzungs //
analyzed: 'phags pa rdo rje'i ri rab chen po'i rtse mo'i khang pa brtsegs pa'i gzungs //
translated: Ārya-mahāvajrameruśikharakūṭāgāradhāraṇī

original: sangs rgyas dang / byang chub sems dpa' thams cad la phyag 'tshal lo //
analyzed: sangs rgyas dang / byang chub sems dpa' thams cad la phyag 'tshal lo //
translated: Homage to all the Buddhas and Bodhisattvas.

original: d'i skad bdag gis thos pa'i dus gcig na; bcom ldan 'das rdo rje'i lhun po chen po'i rtse mo'i khang pa brtsegs pa rdo rje chen po'i ting nge 'dzin gyi sa'i gnas rdo rje chen po'i dpag bsam gyi shing @287b ljon pas legs par brgyan pa /
analyzed: d'i skad bdag gis thos pa'i dus gcig na; bcom ldan 'das rdo rje'i lhun po chen po'i rtse mo'i khang pa brtsegs pa rdo rje chen po'i ting nge 'dzin gyi sa'i gnas rdo rje chen po'i dpag bsam gyi shing @287b ljon pas legs par brgyan pa /
translated: Thus have I heard at one time: The Blessed One was dwelling in the palace on the peak of the great vajra Meru, in the abode of the stage of the great vajra samādhi, well adorned with great vajra wish-fulfilling trees,

original: rdo rje chen po'i rdzing gi rin po che'i padma'i 'od kyis snang bar byas pa /
analyzed: rdo rje chen po'i rdzing gi rin po che'i padma'i 'od kyis snang bar byas pa /
translated: illuminated by the light of the great vajra jeweled lotuses,

original: sa phyogs rdo rje chen po'i bye ma bdal ba /
analyzed: sa phyogs rdo rje chen po'i bye ma bdal ba /
translated: with the ground spread with great vajra sands,

original: rdo rje chen por byin gyis brlabs pa /🔽'khor gyi khyams rdo rje chen po las byas pa /
analyzed: rdo rje chen por byin gyis brlabs pa /🔽'khor gyi khyams rdo rje chen po las byas pa /
translated: blessed with great vajras,🔽and in a great vajra courtyard.

original: lha'i dbang po brgya byin gyis rdo rje chen po'i seng+ge'i khri bye ba khrag khrig 'bum phrag stong gis rnam par mdzes pa /
analyzed: lha'i dbang po brgya byin gyis rdo rje chen po'i seng+ge'i khri bye ba khrag khrig 'bum phrag stong gis rnam par mdzes pa /
translated: Śakra, Lord of the Gods, had arranged a lion throne made of great vajra jewels, which was beautified by a thousand quintillion lion thrones.

original: chos bstan pa dang / cho 'phrul can /
analyzed: chos bstan pa dang / cho 'phrul can /
translated: It was a place where the Dharma was taught and miracles occurred.

original: sangs rgyas thams cad kyi byin gyi rlabs kyis byin gyis brlabs pa /
analyzed: sangs rgyas thams cad kyi byin gyi rlabs kyis byin gyis brlabs pa /
translated: It was blessed by the blessings of all buddhas.

original: chos thams cad kyi mnyam pa nyid la 'jug pa /
analyzed: chos thams cad kyi mnyam pa nyid la 'jug pa /
translated: It was the entrance to the sameness of all phenomena.🔽It was the emergence of omniscience.

original: thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyis nges par 'byung ba na byang chub sems dpa' bye ba khrag khrig 'bum phrag brgyad cu rtsa bzhi thams cad kyang skye ba gcig gis thogs pa /
analyzed: thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyis nges par 'byung ba na byang chub sems dpa' bye ba khrag khrig 'bum phrag brgyad cu rtsa bzhi thams cad kyang skye ba gcig gis thogs pa /
translated: There were 8,400,000,000 bodhisattvas there, all of whom were in their last lifetime,

original: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub las phyir mi ldog pa /
analyzed: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub las phyir mi ldog pa /
translated: irreversible from the highest, complete enlightenment,

original: mthu chen po thob pa /
analyzed: mthu chen po thob pa /
translated: had attained great power,

original: rdo rje chen po'i rnam par thar pa'i ting nge 'dzin gyis sangs rgyas kyi zhing rnam par 'phrul pa dang cho 'phrul chen po kun tu ston pa /
analyzed: rdo rje chen po'i rnam par thar pa'i ting nge 'dzin gyis sangs rgyas kyi zhing rnam par 'phrul pa dang cho 'phrul chen po kun tu ston pa /
translated: and through the samādhi of the great vajra liberation were able to display the emanations and great miracles of the buddha realms.

original: sems kyi skad cig thang gcig yungs tsam gcig la sems can thams cad kyi sems dang spyod pa'i rjes su 'jug pa'i chos bstan pa sna tshogs mnyam pa nyid snyan cing rgya che la zab pa dang / spobs pa dang / cho 'phrul dang ldan pa /
analyzed: sems kyi skad cig thang gcig yungs tsam gcig la sems can thams cad kyi sems dang spyod pa'i rjes su 'jug pa'i chos bstan pa sna tshogs mnyam pa nyid snyan cing rgya che la zab pa dang / spobs pa dang / cho 'phrul dang ldan pa /
translated: In a single instant, a single moment, a single second, they teach the Dharma that accords with the minds and conduct of all sentient beings, a variety of teachings that are equal, pleasant, vast, and profound, and that are endowed with eloquence and miracles.

original: sangs rgyas kyi zhing du mar de bzhin gshegs pa la mchod pa rgya chen @288a *//
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi zhing du mar de bzhin gshegs pa la mchod pa rgya chen @288a *//
translated: They make vast offerings to the Thus-Gone Ones in many buddha realms with clouds of offerings.

original: po'i sprin gyis mchod pa dang / rnam par thar pa'i sgo dang / gzungs dang / ting nge 'dzin dang / dbang dang / mngon par shes pa dang / ma 'dres pa dang / byang chub kyi yan lag dang / lam dang / sa bcu dang /
analyzed: po'i sprin gyis mchod pa dang / rnam par thar pa'i sgo dang / gzungs dang / ting nge 'dzin dang / dbang dang / mngon par shes pa dang / ma 'dres pa dang / byang chub kyi yan lag dang / lam dang / sa bcu dang /
translated: They have the doors of liberation, dhāraṇī, samādhi, power, superknowledge, unshared qualities, factors of awakening, path, and ten grounds.

original: pha rol tu phyin pa dang / thabs la mkhas pa dang / bsdu ba'i dngos po dang / byams pa dang / snying rje dang / dga' ba dang / btang snyoms dang / byams pa'i stobs dang / dben pa dang / yongs su byang ba'i sems kyi rgyun dang ldan pa sha stag la 'di lta ste /
analyzed: pha rol tu phyin pa dang / thabs la mkhas pa dang / bsdu ba'i dngos po dang / byams pa dang / snying rje dang / dga' ba dang / btang snyoms dang / byams pa'i stobs dang / dben pa dang / yongs su byang ba'i sems kyi rgyun dang ldan pa sha stag la 'di lta ste /
translated: They were all endowed with the perfections, skillful means, the four ways of gathering, love, compassion, joy, equanimity, the power of love, solitude, and a mind that was completely purified.

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rdo rje snying po zhes bya ba dang / rdo rje'i mig dang / rdo rje'i lus dang / rdo rje blo gros dang / lag na rdo rje dang / rdo rje 'dus pa dang / rdo rje mthu bo che dang /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rdo rje snying po zhes bya ba dang / rdo rje'i mig dang / rdo rje'i lus dang / rdo rje blo gros dang / lag na rdo rje dang / rdo rje 'dus pa dang / rdo rje mthu bo che dang /
translated: They were the bodhisattva mahāsattva Vajragarbha, Vajranetra, Vajrakaṭhin, Vajramathi, Vajrapāṇi, Vajrasamāja, Vajramahābala,

original: rdo rje rnam par 'phrul pa dang / rdo rje brtsegs pa dang / rdo rje phung po dang / rdo rje nga ro dang / rdo rje bzang po dang / byang chub sems dpa' dpa chen po rdo rje tog ces bya ba dang / de dag la sogs pa byang chub sems dpa' bye ba khrag khrig 'bum phrag brgyad cu rtsa bzhi dang /
analyzed: rdo rje rnam par 'phrul pa dang / rdo rje brtsegs pa dang / rdo rje phung po dang / rdo rje nga ro dang / rdo rje bzang po dang / byang chub sems dpa' dpa chen po rdo rje tog ces bya ba dang / de dag la sogs pa byang chub sems dpa' bye ba khrag khrig 'bum phrag brgyad cu rtsa bzhi dang /
translated: Vajra Play, Vajra Mound, Vajra Aggregate, Vajra Roar, Vajra Good, and the bodhisattva mahāsattva Vajra Crest.

original: nyan thos chen po rab tu mang po thams cad kyang dgra bcom pa /🔽zag pa zad pa /
analyzed: nyan thos chen po rab tu mang po thams cad kyang dgra bcom pa / zag pa zad pa /
translated: There were also many great hearers, all of whom were arhats,🔽who had exhausted the defilements,

original: srid par kun tu sbyor ba zad pa /
analyzed: srid par kun tu sbyor ba zad pa /
translated: who had exhausted the bonds of existence,

original: yang dag pa'i shes pas sems shin tu rnam par grel ba /
analyzed: yang dag pa'i shes pas sems shin tu rnam par grel ba /
translated: who had liberated their minds with right knowledge,

original: rdzu 'phrul gyi stobs dang / cho 'phrul bsam gyis mi @288b khyab pas rnam par 'phrul pa'i mthu chen po thob po //🔽lta ba chags pa med pa /
analyzed: rdzu 'phrul gyi stobs dang / cho 'phrul bsam gyis mi @288b khyab pas rnam par 'phrul pa'i mthu chen po thob po // lta ba chags pa med pa /
translated: and who had attained the great power of magical emanations through inconceivable miraculous powers and miracles.🔽They were free from attachment and

original: thams cad kyang dri ma dang bral ba /
analyzed: thams cad kyang dri ma dang bral ba /
translated: free from all stains.

original: kun nas nyon mongs pa'i bag chags kyi sa bon nges par bsregs pa sha stag la 'di lta ste /🔽tshe dang ldan pa sh'a radva ti'i bu dang / tsha dang ldan pa byams pa'i bu gang po dang / tshe dang ldan pa ka pi na dang / tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor dang / tshe dang ldan pa moo dgal gyi bu chen po dang /
analyzed: kun nas nyon mongs pa'i bag chags kyi sa bon nges par bsregs pa sha stag la 'di lta ste / tshe dang ldan pa sh'a radva ti'i bu dang / tsha dang ldan pa byams pa'i bu gang po dang / tshe dang ldan pa ka pi na dang / tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor dang / tshe dang ldan pa moo dgal gyi bu chen po dang /
translated: They were all arhats who had completely burned away the seeds of the latent tendencies of the afflictions.🔽They were the venerable Śāradvatīputra, the venerable Pūrṇa Maitrāyaniputra, the venerable Kāpya, the venerable Subhūti, the venerable Mahāmaudgalyāyana,

original: tshe dang ldan pa skul byed dang / tshe dang ldan pa dga' byed dang / tshe dang ldan pa ga ya 'od srung dang / tshe dang ldan pa 'od srung chen po dang / tshe dang ldan pa lteng rgyas 'od srung dang / de dag la sogs pa nyan thos chen po rab tu mang po dang /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa skul byed dang / tshe dang ldan pa dga' byed dang / tshe dang ldan pa ga ya 'od srung dang / tshe dang ldan pa 'od srung chen po dang / tshe dang ldan pa lteng rgyas 'od srung dang / de dag la sogs pa nyan thos chen po rab tu mang po dang /
translated: the venerable Cunda, the venerable Nandī, the venerable Gayākāśyapa, the venerable Mahākāśyapa, the venerable Uruvilvā Kāśyapa, and so forth—a great many such śrāvakas,

original: lha'i bu dbang phyug chen po la sogs pa gnas gtsang ma'i ris kyi lha'i bu grangs med dpag tu med pa gzhal du med pa dag dang / mi mjed kyi bdag po tshangs pa dang / lha'i bu tshangs pa bzang po la sogs pa tshangs ris kyi lha'i bu rnams dang /
analyzed: lha'i bu dbang phyug chen po la sogs pa gnas gtsang ma'i ris kyi lha'i bu grangs med dpag tu med pa gzhal du med pa dag dang / mi mjed kyi bdag po tshangs pa dang / lha'i bu tshangs pa bzang po la sogs pa tshangs ris kyi lha'i bu rnams dang /
translated: the sons of the gods of the pure abodes, such as Maheśvara, and countless, immeasurable, and innumerable sons of the gods of the pure abodes;🔽Brahmā, the lord of the Sahā world, and the sons of the gods of the Brahmā group, such as the son of the gods Suśānta;

original: lha'i bu rab 'thab bral g-yog 'thab bral gyi lha'i ris kyi lha'i bu dang bcas pa dang / yongs su dga' ldan dang / 'phrul dga' dang / gzhan 'phrul dbang byed dang / lha'i dbang po brgya byin lha'i bu thams cad kyi 'khor can dang /
analyzed: lha'i bu rab 'thab bral g-yog 'thab bral gyi lha'i ris kyi lha'i bu dang bcas pa dang / yongs su dga' ldan dang / 'phrul dga' dang / gzhan 'phrul dbang byed dang / lha'i dbang po brgya byin lha'i bu thams cad kyi 'khor can dang /
translated: the son of the gods Suyāma, together with the sons of the gods of the Yāma group; the sons of the gods of the Tuṣita, Nirmāṇarati, and Para­nirmita­vaśa­vartin groups; and Śakra, lord of the gods, together with the retinue of all the sons of the gods;

original: lha ma yin gyi dbang po thags bzang ris dang / stobs can dang @289a *//
analyzed: lha ma yin gyi dbang po thags bzang ris dang / stobs can dang @289a *//
translated: the lords of the asuras, such as Vemacitrin and Bali;

original: rab sim dang / sgra gcan dang / rnam par snang byed dang / de dag la sogs pa lha ma yin gyi dbang po tshad med grangs med dpag tu med pa rnams dang / klu'i rgyal po rgya mtsho dang / ma dros pa dang / 'jog po dang /
analyzed: rab sim dang / sgra gcan dang / rnam par snang byed dang / de dag la sogs pa lha ma yin gyi dbang po tshad med grangs med dpag tu med pa rnams dang / klu'i rgyal po rgya mtsho dang / ma dros pa dang / 'jog po dang /
translated: the asura lords such as Rāhu, Vemacitrin, and Vegadhārin, and countless other asura lords; the nāga kings such as Sāgara, Anavatapta, Takṣaka,

original: nor rgyas kyi bu dang / dung skyong dang / stobs kyi rgyu dang / padma dang / padma chen po dang / mtha' yas dang / de dag la sogs pa klu'i rgyal po tshad med grangs med dpag tu med pa dag dang / mi'am ci'i rgyal po ljon pa mi'am ci'i rgyal po'i g-yog du ma can dang dri za'i rgyal po gtsug phud lnga pa dri za'i rgyal po'i g-yog du ma can dang /
analyzed: nor rgyas kyi bu dang / dung skyong dang / stobs kyi rgyu dang / padma dang / padma chen po dang / mtha' yas dang / de dag la sogs pa klu'i rgyal po tshad med grangs med dpag tu med pa dag dang / mi'am ci'i rgyal po ljon pa mi'am ci'i rgyal po'i g-yog du ma can dang dri za'i rgyal po gtsug phud lnga pa dri za'i rgyal po'i g-yog du ma can dang /
translated: Vāsuki, Śaṅkhapāla, Balāhaka, Padma, Mahāpadma, and Ananta, and countless other nāga kings; the kiṃnara king Druma, who is attended by many kiṃnara kings; the gandharva king Pañcaśikha, who is attended by many gandharva kings;

original: rig sngags 'chang gi rgyal po don thams cad grub pa rig snang 'chang gi rgyal po'i g-yog du ma can dang / nam mkha' lding gi rgyal po gser mig nam mkha' lding gi rgyal po'i g-yog du ma can dang / gnod sbyin gyi rgyal po chen po rnam thos kyi bu dang /🔽nor bu bzang dang / gang ba bzang dang / gnod sbyin gyi rgyal po lngas rtsen gnod sbyin gyi rgyal po'i g-yog du ma can dang / 'phrog ma bu lnga brgya'i g-yog can dang / 'jig rten gyi ma bdun dang / sring mo chen mo bdun dang /
analyzed: rig sngags 'chang gi rgyal po don thams cad grub pa rig snang 'chang gi rgyal po'i g-yog du ma can dang / nam mkha' lding gi rgyal po gser mig nam mkha' lding gi rgyal po'i g-yog du ma can dang / gnod sbyin gyi rgyal po chen po rnam thos kyi bu dang / nor bu bzang dang / gang ba bzang dang / gnod sbyin gyi rgyal po lngas rtsen gnod sbyin gyi rgyal po'i g-yog du ma can dang / 'phrog ma bu lnga brgya'i g-yog can dang / 'jig rten gyi ma bdun dang / sring mo chen mo bdun dang /
translated: the king of vidyādhara-s, Sarvanīvaraṇaviṣkambhin, the king of vidyādhara-s, Vidyaprabhāsa, with many attendants; the king of garuḍa-s, Suvarṇākṣa, the king of garuḍa-s, with many attendants; the great yakṣa king Vaiśravaṇa,🔽the yakṣa king Kubera, the yakṣa king Puṇyaraśmi, the yakṣa king Pañcaśikha, the yakṣa king Pañcaśikha, with many attendants; Hārītī, with five hundred sons, with attendants; the seven mothers of the world; the seven great sisters;

original: drang stong chen po bdun dang / bar snang la rgyu ba'i rgyu skar dang / gza'i lha thams cad @289b dang / phyogs kyi lha rnams dang / phyogs mtshams kyi lha rnams dang / sa'i lha dang / dbyangs can dang / 'byung po rnams dang /
analyzed: drang stong chen po bdun dang / bar snang la rgyu ba'i rgyu skar dang / gza'i lha thams cad @289b dang / phyogs kyi lha rnams dang / phyogs mtshams kyi lha rnams dang / sa'i lha dang / dbyangs can dang / 'byung po rnams dang /
translated: the seven great rākṣasa-s; the stars and planets that move in the sky; all the gods of the directions; the gods of the intermediate directions; the gods of the earth; Sarasvatī; the bhūta-s;

original: bgegs rnams dang / log 'dren rnams dang / yi dvags dang / 'byung po rdzu 'phrul chen po rnams dang / re'i rgyal po thams cad dang / 'jig rten skyong ba chu lha g-yog rgya mtsho'i lha thams cad dang bcas pa dang / 'phags skyes po dang /🔽mig mi bzang dang / lag na be con dang / bden bral dang / me'i lha dang / rlung gi lha chen po bdun dang / dbang bdag chung ma dang bcas pa tshogs bye ba khrag khrig 'bum phrag du ma'i 'khor can dang / sred med kyi bu g-yog dang bcas pa dang /
analyzed: bgegs rnams dang / log 'dren rnams dang / yi dvags dang / 'byung po rdzu 'phrul chen po rnams dang / re'i rgyal po thams cad dang / 'jig rten skyong ba chu lha g-yog rgya mtsho'i lha thams cad dang bcas pa dang / 'phags skyes po dang / mig mi bzang dang / lag na be con dang / bden bral dang / me'i lha dang / rlung gi lha chen po bdun dang / dbang bdag chung ma dang bcas pa tshogs bye ba khrag khrig 'bum phrag du ma'i 'khor can dang / sred med kyi bu g-yog dang bcas pa dang /
translated: the obstructors, the misleaders, the ghosts, the powerful spirits, all the kings of the rakshasas, the world protectors, the water gods, the ocean gods, Virudhaka,🔽Virupaksha, Shakra, Yama, Varuna, Kubera, the seven great fire gods, the great wind gods, Shiva with his wife and many hundreds of thousands of millions of retinues, Narayana with his attendants,

original: ma yin dang / nam mkha' lding dang / mi'am ci dang / lto 'phye chen po dang / 'byung po dang / yi dvags dang / sha za dang / smyo byed dang / brjed byed dang / sgrub pa dang / sbrul 'dzin bcas dang / gnon po tshad med dpag tu med grangs med pa rnams dang /
analyzed: ma yin dang / nam mkha' lding dang / mi'am ci dang / lto 'phye chen po dang / 'byung po dang / yi dvags dang / sha za dang / smyo byed dang / brjed byed dang / sgrub pa dang / sbrul 'dzin bcas dang / gnon po tshad med dpag tu med grangs med pa rnams dang /
translated: and also the gods, nāgas, yakṣas, gandharvas, asuras, garuḍas, kinnaras, mahoragas, bhūtas, pretas, piśācas, unmādas, āpasmāras, sādhyas, sarpagrāhās, and grahas who have faith in the Buddha, Dharma, and Saṅgha, and the countless, immeasurable, and innumerable others.

original: lha'i bu nyi ma dang / lha'i bu zla ba dang / dus tshigs kyi lha dang / nub ka'i lha dang / dus kyi lha thams cad dang / gnam sa'i lha thams cad dang yang thabs cig go //
analyzed: lha'i bu nyi ma dang / lha'i bu zla ba dang / dus tshigs kyi lha dang / nub ka'i lha dang / dus kyi lha thams cad dang / gnam sa'i lha thams cad dang yang thabs cig go //
translated: the devas of the sun and moon, the devas of the seasons, the devas of the directions, the devas of the times, the devas of the sky and earth, and all the other devas.

original: de ltar yang bcom ldan 'das de chos kyi 'khor lo ni /🔽shin tu bskor; sangs rgyas kyi mdzad pa ni /
analyzed: de ltar yang bcom ldan 'das de chos kyi 'khor lo ni / shin tu bskor; sangs rgyas kyi mdzad pa ni /
translated: “The Bhagavat had already turned the wheel of the Dharma.

original: shin tu yongs su mthar phyin /🔽bsod nams dang / ye shes kyi tshogs ni /
analyzed: shin tu yongs su mthar phyin / bsod nams dang / ye shes kyi tshogs ni /
translated: He had already accomplished all the deeds of a buddha.

original: shin tu yongs su rdzogs /🔽thams cad mkhyen pa nyid dang / byang chub chen po dang / pha rol tu phyin pa dang / sa brnyes pas ni /
analyzed: shin tu yongs su rdzogs / thams cad mkhyen pa nyid dang / byang chub chen po dang / pha rol tu phyin pa dang / sa brnyes pas ni /
translated: He had already completed the accumulations of merit and wisdom.

original: shin tu yongs su bzung /
analyzed: shin tu yongs su bzung /
translated: He had already attained omniscience, great enlightenment, the perfections, and the bhūmis.🔽He had already attained the thirty-two major marks of a great being,

original: skyes bu chen po'i mtshan 'bar ba sum cu rtsa gnyis kyis ni sku brgyan /
analyzed: skyes bu chen po'i mtshan 'bar ba sum cu rtsa gnyis kyis ni sku brgyan /
translated: which adorned his body,

original: dpe byad bzang po brgyad cus ni /🔽yan lag dang / nying lag thams cad rnam par spras /
analyzed: dpe byad bzang po brgyad cus ni / yan lag dang / nying lag thams cad rnam par spras /
translated: and the eighty minor marks,

original: spyi gtsug ni /
analyzed: spyi gtsug ni /
translated: which beautified all his major and minor body parts.

original: sems can thams cad kyis bltar mi mthong /
analyzed: sems can thams cad kyis bltar mi mthong /
translated: No one could see the top of his head.

original: bdud kyi tsher ma thams cad ni /
analyzed: bdud kyi tsher ma thams cad ni /
translated: are uprooted.

original: dkrugs / de kho na nyid mkhyen pa nyid ni /
analyzed: dkrugs / de kho na nyid mkhyen pa nyid ni /
translated: The knowledge of suchness

original: rim par thugs su chud /
analyzed: rim par thugs su chud /
translated: is fully realized.

original: spyan rnam pa lnga ni /
analyzed: spyan rnam pa lnga ni /
translated: The five types of eyes🔽are possessed.

original: mnga'/ rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa'i mchog @290b dang ni /🔽ldan / thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes dang ni /
analyzed: mnga'/ rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa'i mchog @290b dang ni / ldan / thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes dang ni /
translated: The supreme knowledge of omniscience🔽is possessed.

original: ldan / sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad ni /
analyzed: ldan / sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad ni /
translated: All the qualities of a buddha🔽are possessed.

original: ldan / bdud dang phas kyi rgol ba dang / ngan pa'i tshogs can gyi tshogs thams cad ni; bcom /
analyzed: ldan / bdud dang phas kyi rgol ba dang / ngan pa'i tshogs can gyi tshogs thams cad ni; bcom /
translated: All the hordes of Māra, opponents, and evil ones are defeated.

original: brjod pa'i sgra dang tshigs su bcas pa ni /
analyzed: brjod pa'i sgra dang tshigs su bcas pa ni /
translated: The sounds and verses of expression🔽are exalted.

original: 'phags / khyu mchog dang / seng+ge'i sgra ni sgrog /
analyzed: 'phags / khyu mchog dang / seng+ge'i sgra ni sgrog /
translated: The lion’s roar of the supreme leader is proclaimed.

original: ma rig pa'i mun pa ni kun tu gsal /
analyzed: ma rig pa'i mun pa ni kun tu gsal /
translated: The darkness of ignorance is completely illuminated.

original: bskal pa bye ba khrag khrig 'bum phrag grangs med dpag tu med par sbyin pa dang / tshul khrims dang / bzod pa dang / brtson 'grus dang / bsam gtan dang / shes rab dang / thabs dang / stobs dang / smon lam dang / ye shes kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang /
analyzed: bskal pa bye ba khrag khrig 'bum phrag grangs med dpag tu med par sbyin pa dang / tshul khrims dang / bzod pa dang / brtson 'grus dang / bsam gtan dang / shes rab dang / thabs dang / stobs dang / smon lam dang / ye shes kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang /
translated: For countless, innumerable, hundreds of thousands of millions of eons, he practiced the perfections of generosity, morality, patience, effort, meditation, wisdom, means, power, aspiration, and knowledge.

original: dka' ba spyad pas mngon par grub pa'i skyes bu chen po'i mtshan sum cu rtsa gnyis dang / dpe byad bzang po brgyad cus sku brgyan pas ni /🔽mdzes shing / rin po che rdo rje'i padma'i snying po'i seng+ge'i khri la ni /
analyzed: dka' ba spyad pas mngon par grub pa'i skyes bu chen po'i mtshan sum cu rtsa gnyis dang / dpe byad bzang po brgyad cus sku brgyan pas ni / mdzes shing / rin po che rdo rje'i padma'i snying po'i seng+ge'i khri la ni /
translated: He accomplished the thirty-two marks and eighty minor marks of a great being through the practice of austerities.🔽He sat on a lion throne in the center of a jeweled vajra lotus.

original: bzhugs te / gdan rin po che dang / rdo rje'i padma'i seng+ge'i khri ri rab tsam rdo rje dang / rin po che dang / mu tig dang ldan pa'i dril bu g-yer ka'i dra ba du ma sil sil sgra 'byung ba /
analyzed: bzhugs te / gdan rin po che dang / rdo rje'i padma'i seng+ge'i khri ri rab tsam rdo rje dang / rin po che dang / mu tig dang ldan pa'i dril bu g-yer ka'i dra ba du ma sil sil sgra 'byung ba /
translated: The jeweled vajra lotus lion throne was as large as Mount Meru, and it was adorned with many nets of small bells made of vajras, jewels, and pearls that jingled.

original: rdo rje dag rin po che du ma'i stegs bu la rtsa pa legs par brten pa; rdo rje dang rin po che du ma'i chu srin gyi kha nas byung ba'i mu tig dmar po'i phreng ba dang ldan pa'i snam rten dang bcas pa /🔽rin po che du ma'i padma'i snying po la chags @291a *//🔽pa'i rin po che ke ke ru dang / ke ke ru chen po dang / aanda rnyil dang / mthon ka chen po dang / dun las du ma'i 'od zer 'bar bas snang bar gyur pas kun tu mdzes pa /
analyzed: rdo rje dag rin po che du ma'i stegs bu la rtsa pa legs par brten pa; rdo rje dang rin po che du ma'i chu srin gyi kha nas byung ba'i mu tig dmar po'i phreng ba dang ldan pa'i snam rten dang bcas pa / rin po che du ma'i padma'i snying po la chags @291a *// pa'i rin po che ke ke ru dang / ke ke ru chen po dang / aanda rnyil dang / mthon ka chen po dang / dun las du ma'i 'od zer 'bar bas snang bar gyur pas kun tu mdzes pa /
translated: It was made of pure vajra and was supported by many precious pillars. It was adorned with a canopy of red pearls that came from the mouths of sea monsters made of vajra and many precious substances.🔽It was beautiful with the light of many precious gems, such as sapphires, great sapphires, emeralds, great emeralds, and rubies, shining on the heart of a lotus made of many precious substances.

original: rin po che dang / rdo rje'i thur mas brgyan pa'i gdugs yu bas bstod pa bye ba khrag khrig 'bum phrag du mas grib mar bsgribs shing bskyabs pa /
analyzed: rin po che dang / rdo rje'i thur mas brgyan pa'i gdugs yu bas bstod pa bye ba khrag khrig 'bum phrag du mas grib mar bsgribs shing bskyabs pa /
translated: It was shaded and protected by many quintillions of parasols made of precious substances and vajra, with handles of gold.

original: dpag bsam gyi shing du mas mdzes par byas pa rgya che ba la bzhugs te gser gyi ri bo ltar dpal gyis 'bar ba /
analyzed: dpag bsam gyi shing du mas mdzes par byas pa rgya che ba la bzhugs te gser gyi ri bo ltar dpal gyis 'bar ba /
translated: It was beautified by many wish-fulfilling trees and was vast. He was seated there, blazing with splendor like a mountain of gold.

original: nyi ma stong bas lhag pa'i 'od kyi dkyil 'khor 'byor pas sa phyogs mdzes par gyur ba /
analyzed: nyi ma stong bas lhag pa'i 'od kyi dkyil 'khor 'byor pas sa phyogs mdzes par gyur ba /
translated: He beautified the area with a halo of light that was brighter than a thousand suns.

original: zla ba nya ba ltar 'jig rten kun gyis mthong na dga' ba /
analyzed: zla ba nya ba ltar 'jig rten kun gyis mthong na dga' ba /
translated: He was as delightful to behold as the full moon.

original: dpag bsam gyi shing ljon pa chen po ltar sangs rgyas kyi chos rnams kyis yang dag par rgyas par chos ston te /🔽tshangs par spyod pa /
analyzed: dpag bsam gyi shing ljon pa chen po ltar sangs rgyas kyi chos rnams kyis yang dag par rgyas par chos ston te / tshangs par spyod pa /
translated: He was like a great wish-fulfilling tree, and he taught the Dharma in order to perfect the qualities of a buddha.🔽He taught pure conduct,

original: thog mar dge ba /🔽bar du dge ba /
analyzed: thog mar dge ba / bar du dge ba /
translated: which is virtuous in the beginning,🔽virtuous in the middle,

original: tha mar dge ba /🔽don bzang po /
analyzed: tha mar dge ba / don bzang po /
translated: and virtuous in the end.

original: tshig 'bru bzang po /
analyzed: tshig 'bru bzang po /
translated: It has a good meaning and a good delivery.

original: ma 'dres pa /
analyzed: ma 'dres pa /
translated: It is unadulterated,

original: yongs su rdzogs pa /🔽yongs su dag pa /
analyzed: yongs su rdzogs pa / yongs su dag pa /
translated: complete,🔽pure,

original: yongs su dkar ba yang dag par ston to //
analyzed: yongs su dkar ba yang dag par ston to //
translated: and completely white.

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyi spyi gtsug gi mtshams kyi mdzod spu nas sangs rgyas kyi zhing thams cad kun tu ston pa zhes bya ba'i 'od zer gyi dra ba chen po byung ste /
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyi spyi gtsug gi mtshams kyi mdzod spu nas sangs rgyas kyi zhing thams cad kun tu ston pa zhes bya ba'i 'od zer gyi dra ba chen po byung ste /
translated: Then from the ūrṇā hair between the eyebrows of the Bhagavān, a great web of light rays called the display of all buddha realms appeared.

original: 'od zer gyi dra ba des stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten gyi khams @291b 'di snang bas gsal bar byas par gyur to //
analyzed: 'od zer gyi dra ba des stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten gyi khams @291b 'di snang bas gsal bar byas par gyur to //
translated: The net of light rays illuminated this great trichiliocosm.

original: gang+g'a'i klung gi bye ma ji snyed pa dang mnyam pa'i sangs rgyas kyi zhing de dag thams cad kyang snang ba des gsal bar snang bar gyur to //
analyzed: gang+g'a'i klung gi bye ma ji snyed pa dang mnyam pa'i sangs rgyas kyi zhing de dag thams cad kyang snang ba des gsal bar snang bar gyur to //
translated: All the buddha realms equal to the number of grains of sand in the Ganges River were also illuminated by that light.

original: sangs rgyas kyi zhing de dag na sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das gang dag bzhugs pa de dag kyang seng+ge'i khri du ma bkod pa'i khang pa brtsegs pa'i gzhal med khang rnams na chos ston to //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi zhing de dag na sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das gang dag bzhugs pa de dag kyang seng+ge'i khri du ma bkod pa'i khang pa brtsegs pa'i gzhal med khang rnams na chos ston to //
translated: The blessed buddhas who were present in those buddha realms were teaching the Dharma in the palaces of the multistoried mansions of the lion thrones.

original: nyan thos chen po de dag dang / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po dag dang thabs cig go /
analyzed: nyan thos chen po de dag dang / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po dag dang thabs cig go /
translated: They were together with the great hearers and the bodhisattva great beings.

original: dge slong dang / dge slong ma dang / dge bsnyen dang / dge bsnyen ma dang / lha dang / klu dang / gnod sbyin dang / dri za dang / lha ma yin dang / nam mkha' lding dang / mi 'am ci dang / lto 'phye chen po rnams dang yang thabs cig go /
analyzed: dge slong dang / dge slong ma dang / dge bsnyen dang / dge bsnyen ma dang / lha dang / klu dang / gnod sbyin dang / dri za dang / lha ma yin dang / nam mkha' lding dang / mi 'am ci dang / lto 'phye chen po rnams dang yang thabs cig go /
translated: with the bhikṣus, bhikṣuṇīs, upāsakas, upāsikās, devas, nāgas, yakṣas, gandharvas, asuras, garuḍas, kinnaras, and mahoragas;

original: de dag thams cad kyang rdo rje'i lhun po chen po'i rtse mo'i khang pa brtsegs pa'i gzungs yang dag par rab tu ston to //
analyzed: de dag thams cad kyang rdo rje'i lhun po chen po'i rtse mo'i khang pa brtsegs pa'i gzungs yang dag par rab tu ston to //
translated: all of them were teaching the dhāraṇī of the multistoried palace on the peak of the great vajra mountain;

original: de dag thams cad kyang kun tu snang ngo //
analyzed: de dag thams cad kyang kun tu snang ngo //
translated: all of them were visible.

original: skad cig de la sems can de dag thams cad bde ba thams cad kyis tshim par gyur to //
analyzed: skad cig de la sems can de dag thams cad bde ba thams cad kyis tshim par gyur to //
translated: At that moment all those beings were satisfied with all happiness.

original: 'on pa rnams ni /
analyzed: 'on pa rnams ni /
translated: The deaf

original: sgra thos so //
analyzed: sgra thos so //
translated: heard sounds.

original: long ba rnams ni /
analyzed: long ba rnams ni /
translated: The blind

original: mig thob bo //
analyzed: mig thob bo //
translated: regained their sight.🔽The insane

original: smyon pa rnams ni; dran pa rnyed do //
analyzed: smyon pa rnams ni; dran pa rnyed do //
translated: regained their memory.

original: nad pa rnams ni /
analyzed: nad pa rnams ni /
translated: The sick

original: sos par gyur to //
analyzed: sos par gyur to //
translated: were cured.

original: sbrum ma rnams ni /
analyzed: sbrum ma rnams ni /
translated: The pregnant

original: bde bar btsas so //
analyzed: bde bar btsas so //
translated: gave birth easily.

original: sems can dmyal ba thams cad kyi sdug bsngal rnams ni /
analyzed: sems can dmyal ba thams cad kyi sdug bsngal rnams ni /
translated: All the sufferings of the hells

original: med @292a *// par gyur to //
analyzed: med @292a *// par gyur to //
translated: disappeared.

original: yud tsam de la dud 'gro'i skye gnas dang / yi dvags kyi skye gnas dang / gshin rje'i 'jig rten rnams kyis ming yang mi grags par gyur to; ;'jig rten gyi bar gang dag mun pa mun nag dang / mun pa mun nag chen por 'dug pa de dag thams cad gsal bar snang bar gyur to //
analyzed: yud tsam de la dud 'gro'i skye gnas dang / yi dvags kyi skye gnas dang / gshin rje'i 'jig rten rnams kyis ming yang mi grags par gyur to; ;'jig rten gyi bar gang dag mun pa mun nag dang / mun pa mun nag chen por 'dug pa de dag thams cad gsal bar snang bar gyur to //
translated: In that moment, the names of the animal realm, the world of the pretas, and the world of Yama became unknown. All the spaces between worlds that were filled with darkness, great darkness, and pitch black darkness became illuminated.

original: der sems can gang dag skyes pa de dag thams cad dang / sems can gzhan 'dir skyes pa rnams kyang gcig gis gcig shes so //
analyzed: der sems can gang dag skyes pa de dag thams cad dang / sems can gzhan 'dir skyes pa rnams kyang gcig gis gcig shes so //
translated: All the beings who were born there, and the other beings who were born there, recognized each other.

original: de nas sems can de dag thams cad kyis ngo mtshar rmad du byung ba'i chos kyi dga' ba thob ste mchog gis tshim par gyur nas kun tu bltas pa dang / de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas mthong ste de dag gis gser gyi mchod sdong ltar dpal gyis 'bar zhing rang gi gzi brjid kyis mngon par 'phags pa de mthong nas de nyid la skyabs su dong ngo //
analyzed: de nas sems can de dag thams cad kyis ngo mtshar rmad du byung ba'i chos kyi dga' ba thob ste mchog gis tshim par gyur nas kun tu bltas pa dang / de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas mthong ste de dag gis gser gyi mchod sdong ltar dpal gyis 'bar zhing rang gi gzi brjid kyis mngon par 'phags pa de mthong nas de nyid la skyabs su dong ngo //
translated: They saw the Tathāgata, the Arhat, the Perfectly Enlightened One. Seeing him, blazing with splendor like a golden sacrificial post, exalted by his own radiance, they went to him for refuge.

original: skyabs su dong ma thag tu de dag thams cad de bzhin gshegs pa'i 'khor gyi dkyil 'khor de nyid du bdag son pa snyam du shes so //
analyzed: skyabs su dong ma thag tu de dag thams cad de bzhin gshegs pa'i 'khor gyi dkyil 'khor de nyid du bdag son pa snyam du shes so //
translated: As soon as they had gone for refuge, they all thought they had arrived in the very midst of the Tathāgata's retinue.

original: snang ba des bdud kyi khyim thams cad kun tu 'bar //
analyzed: snang ba des bdud kyi khyim thams cad kun tu 'bar //
translated: That light appeared to all the māra's houses as if they were burning,

original: rab tu 'bar /
analyzed: rab tu 'bar /
translated: blazing,

original: kun tu rab tu mched cing 'bar te me lce gcig tu gyur par kun tu snang ngo //
analyzed: kun tu rab tu mched cing 'bar te me lce gcig tu gyur par kun tu snang ngo //
translated: spreading and burning with a single flame.

original: bdud kyi ris @292b kyi lha de dag kyang skad cig de la nyam thag pa'i sgrar du zhing skrag nas byer ro //
analyzed: bdud kyi ris @292b kyi lha de dag kyang skad cig de la nyam thag pa'i sgrar du zhing skrag nas byer ro //
translated: And the gods of the class of Māra, in that very instant, cried out in distress and fled in fear.

original: bdud sdig can yang bzhin bzang po rnyi rnyi por gyur cing lus rdul nas bdud kyi ris kyi lha'i bu thams cad la smras pa /
analyzed: bdud sdig can yang bzhin bzang po rnyi rnyi por gyur cing lus rdul nas bdud kyi ris kyi lha'i bu thams cad la smras pa /
translated: Māra, the evil one, with a pale and drawn face, his body covered in dust, said to all the gods of the class of Māra:

original: grogs po dag /
analyzed: grogs po dag /
translated: “Friends,

original: bdud kyi khyim thams cad kun tu 'bar /
analyzed: bdud kyi khyim thams cad kun tu 'bar /
translated: all the houses of Māra are burning,

original: rab tu 'bar /
analyzed: rab tu 'bar /
translated: burning fiercely,

original: kun tu rab tu mched cing 'bar te me lce gcig tu gyur pa dang / dge sbyong go'u ma ri rab kyi rtse mo'i khang pa brtsegs pa na chos bstan pa 'di la ltos /
analyzed: kun tu rab tu mched cing 'bar te me lce gcig tu gyur pa dang / dge sbyong go'u ma ri rab kyi rtse mo'i khang pa brtsegs pa na chos bstan pa 'di la ltos /
translated: flaming, and blazing with a single tongue of flame. And look at the ascetic Gautama, who is teaching the Dharma in the terraced mansion on the peak of Mount Sumeru.

original: des bdag cag phung ngo //
analyzed: des bdag cag phung ngo //
translated: He has destroyed us!

original: mtho brtsams so //
analyzed: mtho brtsams so //
translated: He has made us rise up!

original: phyogs gang na gnas su gtol med do //
analyzed: phyogs gang na gnas su gtol med do //
translated: We do not know where to go to be safe.

original: longs la dge sbyong go'u ta ma de'i gan du dong ste bdud kyi yul 'di thal bar byas par ma gyur gyi bar du gzhom mo //
analyzed: longs la dge sbyong go'u ta ma de'i gan du dong ste bdud kyi yul 'di thal bar byas par ma gyur gyi bar du gzhom mo //
translated: Rise up! Let us go to the ascetic Gautama and destroy him before he reduces the domain of Māra to ashes!”

original: de skad ces smras pa dang / bdud kyi ris kyi lha'i bu de dag thams cad kyis rje bka' bzhin 'tshal zhes smras nas rang rang gi gnas su dong ste lag na mtshon cha sna tshogs can /
analyzed: de skad ces smras pa dang / bdud kyi ris kyi lha'i bu de dag thams cad kyis rje bka' bzhin 'tshal zhes smras nas rang rang gi gnas su dong ste lag na mtshon cha sna tshogs can /
translated: When he had spoken thus, all the sons of the gods of Mara's retinue said, We will do as you command. They went to their own abodes and, in an instant, assembled together.🔽They had various weapons in their hands,

original: lus la go cha sna tshogs pa /
analyzed: lus la go cha sna tshogs pa /
translated: various armors on their bodies,

original: cha byad dang / rgyan sna tshogs can /
analyzed: cha byad dang / rgyan sna tshogs can /
translated: various costumes and ornaments,

original: mche ba mi bzad par 'jigs su rung ba /
analyzed: mche ba mi bzad par 'jigs su rung ba /
translated: frightful with their terrible fangs,

original: bzhin mi sdug par bsgyur ba /
analyzed: bzhin mi sdug par bsgyur ba /
translated: their faces distorted,🔽their eyes, faces, and hair all ablaze.

original: mig dang / bzhin dang / skra kun tu 'bar zhing rab tu 'bar ba dag skad cig de nyid la gcig tu 'dus nas bdud sdig can ga la ba der dong ste phyin nas bdud sdig can la 'di skad ces smras so //
analyzed: mig dang / bzhin dang / skra kun tu 'bar zhing rab tu 'bar ba dag skad cig de nyid la gcig tu 'dus nas bdud sdig can ga la ba der dong ste phyin nas bdud sdig can la 'di skad ces smras so //
translated: They went to where Mara, the evil one, was and said this to him:

original: bzhengs bzhengs thog mar bzhud @293a *//
analyzed: bzhengs bzhengs thog mar bzhud @293a *//
translated: Rise up, rise up! Let us go first!

original: la ji tsam du dge sbyong go'u ta ma nyan thos dang / byang chub sems dpa'i dge 'dun dang bcas ba de ci nas kyang phyis bdag cag gi yul du gnod pa cung zad kyang mi bskyed pa dang / bdag cag gi yul gnod par mi 'gyur bar deng nyid du phye mar brlag go /
analyzed: la ji tsam du dge sbyong go'u ta ma nyan thos dang / byang chub sems dpa'i dge 'dun dang bcas ba de ci nas kyang phyis bdag cag gi yul du gnod pa cung zad kyang mi bskyed pa dang / bdag cag gi yul gnod par mi 'gyur bar deng nyid du phye mar brlag go /

original: rnam par gzhom mo //

original: bdud sdig can ni /

translated: Then Vajrapāṇi, Lord of Secrets, having praised the Blessed One with these fitting verses, again sat in the heart of the jeweled lotus.

analyzed: lhan ne / lhang nge'o //

Having arrived, they made great offerings to the bhagavān, the tathāgata, the arhat, the perfectly enlightened buddha Śākyamuni and to Guhyapati Vajrapāṇi with clouds of offerings,

original: gdugs kyi sprin dang / rgyan phreng gi sprin dang / dbu rgyan gyi sprin kyi sprin dang / me tog gi sprin dang / na bza'i sprin chen pos mchod pa chen po @297a *//

translated: clouds of parasols, clouds of garlands, clouds of tiaras, clouds of flowers, and great clouds of clothing.

original: byas nas nam mkha'i dkyil na 'khod bzhin du bcom ldan 'das sh'akya thub pa la lan bdun bskor ba byas te pus mo g-yas pa'i lha nga rin po che'i padma'i rdo rje'i stan la btsugs nas bcom ldan 'das logs su lta zhing bcom ldan 'das la phyag 'tshal

translated: Having done so, while remaining in the middle of the sky, they circumambulated Lord Śākyamuni seven times, and then, kneeling on their right knees on the vajra seats of precious lotuses, they bowed to the Bhagavat and gazed at him.

original: ba dang / de bzhin gshegs pas gnang nas rang rang gi rin po che'i padma'i rdo rje'i stan de dag la 'khod par gyur to //

original: de'i tshe shar phyogs logs na 'jig rten gyi khams rdo rje tog ces bya ba de na de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas rdo rje'i snying pos rab tu 'joms pa zhes bya ba da ltar bzhugs te 'tsho zhing bzhes te;

translated: At that time, in the eastern direction, in the world system called Vajraketu, the Tathāgata, the Arhat, the Perfectly Awakened One, Vajra­garbha­pra­maraṇa, now present, living, and remaining,

original: 'di ltar rdo rje'i ri rab chen po'i rtse mo'i khang pa brtsegs pa'i gzungs 'di nyid las brtsams te chos kyang ston to //
analyzed: 'di ltar rdo rje'i ri rab chen po'i rtse mo'i khang pa brtsegs pa'i gzungs 'di nyid las brtsams te chos kyang ston to //
translated: In this way, he taught the Dharma, beginning with this dhāraṇī of the great vajra-peak palace.

translated: The light of the blazing vajra illuminated all those world systems.

original: yang dag @297b par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas rdo rje'i snying pos rab tu 'joms pa zhes bya ba de la zhus te /
analyzed: yang dag @297b par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas rdo rje'i snying pos rab tu 'joms pa zhes bya ba de la zhus te /
translated: Then, in that world system, the bodhisattva mahāsattva Vajragarbha, who was present in the retinue of that tathāgata, saw that marvel and asked the tathāgata, the arhat, the perfectly enlightened buddha Vajragarbha,

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: the Blessed One,

analyzed: rdo rje 'bar ba'i snang ba 'di lta bu gang gis 'jig rten gyi khams 'di thams cad snang bar gyur te /
translated: what is this light of the blazing vajra that illuminates all these world systems?

original: sems can thams cad kyi sdug bsngal thams cad rgyun chad cing sems can dmyal ba dang / dud 'gro'i skye gnas dang / yi dvags dang / gshin rje'i 'jig rten gyi sdug bsngal thams cad mi gda' bar gyur /
analyzed: sems can thams cad kyi sdug bsngal thams cad rgyun chad cing sems can dmyal ba dang / dud 'gro'i skye gnas dang / yi dvags dang / gshin rje'i 'jig rten gyi sdug bsngal thams cad mi gda' bar gyur /
translated: May all the sufferings of all sentient beings be cut off, and may the sufferings of all the hells, animal realms, hungry ghosts, and the world of Yama cease.

original: lha dang / klu dang / gnod sbyin dang / dri za dang / lha ma yin dang / nam mkha' lding dang / mi 'am ci dang lto 'phye chen po la sogs pa 'jig rten na rdzu 'phrul che zhing dbang che bar grags pa thams cad kyang kun nas mchod pa'i sprin chen pos dga' ba dang /

translated: May all the gods, nāgas, yakṣas, gandharvas, asuras, garuḍas, kinnaras, mahoragas, and so forth—all those renowned in the world for their great miracles and power—rejoice and be delighted by the great clouds of offerings.

original: yid bde ba skyes te nub phyogs su mchi bar 'da' ba 'di su'i lags /
analyzed: yid bde ba skyes te nub phyogs su mchi bar 'da' ba 'di su'i lags /

translated: Then the Tathāgata, the Arhat, the Perfectly Awakened One Vajra Essence, the One of Sharp Intellect, said this to the Bodhisattva Mahāsattva Vajra Essence:

translated: Son of noble family,🔽in the western direction, in the Sahā world system, there is the Tathāgata, the Arhat, the Perfectly Awakened One Śākyamuni, who teaches the Dharma discourse called the Dhāraṇī of the Palace on the Peak of Mount Meru of Great Vajra,

translated: in the Palace on the Peak of Mount Meru of Great Vajra.

original: bcom ldan 'das des spyi gtsug gi mtshams kyi mdzod spu nas 'od zer gyi dra ba chen po phyung ste 'od zer gyi dra ba chen po des 'jig rten gyi khams der bdud sdig can bskul ma thag tu kun tu khros nas lha'i bu thams cad dang /

translated: The bhagavān emitted a great web of light rays from the ūrṇā hair between his eyebrows.🔽That great web of light rays immediately angered Māra, the evil one, in that world realm. He became very angry and, together with all the devaputras,

analyzed: gzhan yang bdud kyi ris kyi lha'i bu rnams dang / dpung gi tshogs chen po dang lhan cig tu bcom ldan 'das de la gtse ba'i phyir lhags pa dang / de yang sangs rgyas kyi mthus de bzhin gshegs pa'i 'khor gyi khyams de nyid du zhags pa lnga'i bcing pas bcings nas bcom ldan 'das kyi spyan sngar 'gyel te /
translated: the other devaputras of the māra class, and a great army, he came to harm the bhagavān. However, through the power of the Buddha, he was bound by five fetters in the very same maṇḍala of the tathāgata and fell to the ground in front of the bhagavān.

original: de la thugs brtse ba'i phyir bcom ldan 'das des byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po gsang ba pa'i bdag po lag na rdo rje la ston cig par bka' lung byin nas gsang ba pa'i bdag po lag na rdo rje des rdo rje'i rnam par thar pa'i

translated: Out of compassion for him, the Blessed One instructed the bodhisattva mahāsattva Vajrapāṇi, the lord of guhyakas, to teach him.🔽Vajrapāṇi, the lord of guhyakas, entered the samādhi called the great door of the vajra liberation

analyzed: 'di ni / rdo rje de dag nyid rdo rje 'bar ba'i snang ba'o //

translated: The bodhisattvas in the maṇḍala of the retinue of those bodhisattvas were also invoked. They were astonished and each asked the tathāgata, the arhat, the perfectly enlightened buddha, ‘Bhagavān, who is this?’

translated: “Noble son, by the power of that, they saw me in the presence of the bhagavān, the tathāgata, the arhat, the perfectly enlightened buddha Śākyamuni, serving and venerating him.”

translated: I will go to that Sahā world to see the Tathāgata, the Arhat, the Perfectly Awakened One Śākyamuni, to pay homage to him, to honor him, and

translated: to see the Lord of Secrets Vajrapāṇi.”

original: de skad ces gsol pa dang / de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas rdo rje'i snying pos rab tu 'joms pas byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rdo rje'i snying po de la 'di skad ces bka' stsal to; ;rigs kyi bu /
analyzed: de skad ces gsol pa dang / de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas rdo rje'i snying pos rab tu 'joms pas byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rdo rje'i snying po de la 'di skad ces bka' stsal to; ;rigs kyi bu /
translated: Son of noble family,

original: de'i dus la da bab par shes na song zhig /
analyzed: de'i dus la da bab par shes na song zhig /
translated: if you know that the time has come, then go.

original: de nas byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rdo rje'i snying po bcom ldan 'das des gnang nas bcom ldan 'das de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas rdo rje'i snying pos rab tu 'joms pa de la lan bdun bskor ba
analyzed: de nas byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rdo rje'i snying po bcom ldan 'das des gnang nas bcom ldan 'das de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas rdo rje'i snying pos rab tu 'joms pa de la lan bdun bskor ba
translated: Then, with the permission of that Blessed One, the Bodhisattva Mahasattva Vajra Heart circumambulated the Blessed Tathagata, the Arhat, the Perfectly Awakened One Vajra Heart of Infinite Space seven times,

original: byas te 'jig rten gyi khams de nas mi snang bar gyur nas nam mkha'i dkyil gyi lam nas byang chub sems dpa' bye ba khrag khrig 'bum phrag dgu bcu rtsa dgu dang lhan cig tu byang chub sems dpa'i rnam par 'phrul pa chen po dang /
analyzed: byas te 'jig rten gyi khams de nas mi snang bar gyur nas nam mkha'i dkyil gyi lam nas byang chub sems dpa' bye ba khrag khrig 'bum phrag dgu bcu rtsa dgu dang lhan cig tu byang chub sems dpa'i rnam par 'phrul pa chen po dang /
translated: Having done so, they disappeared from that world realm and, traveling through the sky, they arrived together with nine hundred and ninety billion bodhisattvas in this Sahā world realm.🔽They arrived through the great miraculous power of the bodhisattvas and the great miraculous power of the bodhisattvas.

original: byang chub sems dpa'i rdzu 'phrul chen pos 'jig rten gyi khams mi mjed 'di ga la ba der song ste phyin nas byang chub sems dpa' de dag thams cad dang lhan cig smra ba na /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i rdzu 'phrul chen pos 'jig rten gyi khams mi mjed 'di ga la ba der song ste phyin nas byang chub sems dpa' de dag thams cad dang lhan cig smra ba na /
translated: When they arrived, they all spoke together with those bodhisattvas.

original: bsod nams kyi tshogs chen po bsags pa las grub pas @299b byin pa'i rin po che de dag las 'od zer 'di lta ste /
analyzed: bsod nams kyi tshogs chen po bsags pa las grub pas @299b byin pa'i rin po che de dag las 'od zer 'di lta ste /
translated: The light rays from those jewels, which were created by the accumulation of great merit, were like this:

original: sngon po dang / ser po dang / dmar po dang / ljang sngon dang / ljang ser dang / btsod ka dang / shel dang / dngul dang / nor bu dang / mu tig dang / gser dang / padma r'a ga dang // rdo'i snying po dang /
analyzed: sngon po dang / ser po dang / dmar po dang / ljang sngon dang / ljang ser dang / btsod ka dang / shel dang / dngul dang / nor bu dang / mu tig dang / gser dang / padma r'a ga dang // rdo'i snying po dang /
translated: yellow, red, green, orange, purple, crystal, silver, jewels, pearls, gold, rubies,

original: ke ke ru dang / ke ke ru chen po dang / aanda rnyil dang / mthon ka chen po dang / dun las dang / go mu ta ra ga dang / mu tig dkar po'i kha dog lta bu rnams byung ste /
analyzed: ke ke ru dang / ke ke ru chen po dang / aanda rnyil dang / mthon ka chen po dang / dun las dang / go mu ta ra ga dang / mu tig dkar po'i kha dog lta bu rnams byung ste /
translated: cat’s eyes, sapphires, emeralds, and white pearls.

original: de dag gis thams cad dang ldan pa'i 'jig rten gyi khams la lan 'bum phrag du mar bskor ba byas te steng gi ngar snang khyab par byas nas lha'i snang bas snang bar byas te 'dus nas 'ja' lta bur gyur to //
analyzed: de dag gis thams cad dang ldan pa'i 'jig rten gyi khams la lan 'bum phrag du mar bskor ba byas te steng gi ngar snang khyab par byas nas lha'i snang bas snang bar byas te 'dus nas 'ja' lta bur gyur to //
translated: They circled the entire world many hundreds of thousands of times, filling the sky above with divine light. Then they gathered together and disappeared like a rainbow.

original: bcom ldan 'das de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas sh'akya thub pa'i zhabs mtshan thams cad phun sum tshogs pa /

original: 'jam pa / mnyen pa /🔽rab tu gzhon pa /
analyzed: 'jam pa / mnyen pa / rab tu gzhon pa /
translated: tender,

original: sha rgyas pa /
analyzed: sha rgyas pa /

original: snum pa / long bu gnyis kyi rtsa mi mngon pa /
analyzed: snum pa / long bu gnyis kyi rtsa mi mngon pa /

original: padma gsar du kha phye ba lta bu /

analyzed: dung dang / nya dang / rdo rje dang / rgyal mtshan dang / lcags kyu dang / padma dang / chu srin ma ka ra'i mtshan dang ldan pa gnyis la lan 'bum phrag du mar bskor ba byas nas nub par gyur to //
translated: and which bear the marks of a conch, a fish, a vajra, a victory banner, a hook, a lotus, and a makara.

translated: In the same way, the lotuses are made of many kinds of jewels.

original: rin po che'i padma re re la yang sa bcu la rab tu gnas pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po kun tu mdzes pa'i spyod lam phun sum tshogs pa dag ting nge 'dzin la @301a *//🔽snyoms par zhugs so //
