analyzed: mjed 'dir 'ongs te bcom ldan 'das kyis gnang nas chos mnyan pa'i phyir byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de dag dang lhan cig tu rin po che'i padma'i snying po la 'dug cing /
translated: Bhagavat, having come to this Sahaloka world system with the permission of the bhagavat, sat on the heart of a jeweled lotus in order to listen to the Dharma together with those bodhisattva mahasattvas.

original: rigs kyi bu de dag kyang chos mnyan pa'i phyir de bzhin du rin po che'i padma'i snying po dag la 'khod pa'i bar du'o //
analyzed: rigs kyi bu de dag kyang chos mnyan pa'i phyir de bzhin du rin po che'i padma'i snying po dag la 'khod pa'i bar du'o //
translated: Those sons of family, in order to listen to the Dharma, sat on the hearts of jeweled lotuses in the same way.

original: de bzhin du 'og gi phyogs na bcom ldan 'das de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas rin chen padma la rab tu gnas pa'i ri dbang gi rgyal po'i sangs rgyas kyi zhing 'jig rten gyi khams padma bkod pa nas byang chub
analyzed: de bzhin du 'og gi phyogs na bcom ldan 'das de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas rin chen padma la rab tu gnas pa'i ri dbang gi rgyal po'i sangs rgyas kyi zhing 'jig rten gyi khams padma bkod pa nas byang chub
translated: In the same way, from the world system called Lotus Array, in the buddha realm of the blessed, thus-gone, worthy, perfect buddha Jewel Lotus Standing Mountain King, the bodhisattva great being Ākāśamati, surrounded and venerated by many quintillions of bodhisattvas,

original: @308a *// sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po nam mkha'i blo gros zhes bya ba byang chub sems dpa' bye ba khrag khrig 'bum phrag du mas yongs su bskor te mdun du bdar ba nas 'jig rten gyi khams mi mjed 'dir 'ongs te /
analyzed: @308a *// sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po nam mkha'i blo gros zhes bya ba byang chub sems dpa' bye ba khrag khrig 'bum phrag du mas yongs su bskor te mdun du bdar ba nas 'jig rten gyi khams mi mjed 'dir 'ongs te /
translated: came to this Sahā world system.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis gnang nas rin po che'i padma'i snying po la 'dug cing /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis gnang nas rin po che'i padma'i snying po la 'dug cing /
translated: With the permission of the Blessed One, he sat on the heart of a precious lotus.

original: rigs kyi bu de dag thams cad kyang chos nyan pa'i phyir de bzhin du rin po che'i padma'i snying po dag la 'khod pa'i bar du'o //
analyzed: rigs kyi bu de dag thams cad kyang chos nyan pa'i phyir de bzhin du rin po che'i padma'i snying po dag la 'khod pa'i bar du'o //
translated: All those sons of noble family also sat on the hearts of precious lotuses in order to listen to the Dharma.

original: de bzhin du steng gi phyogs na bcom ldan 'das de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas g-yul las rnam par rgyal ba'i dpal gyi sangs rgyas kyi zhing 'jig rten gyi khams bdud kyi tsher ma dkrugs pa nas byang chub sems dpa'
analyzed: de bzhin du steng gi phyogs na bcom ldan 'das de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas g-yul las rnam par rgyal ba'i dpal gyi sangs rgyas kyi zhing 'jig rten gyi khams bdud kyi tsher ma dkrugs pa nas byang chub sems dpa'
translated: In the same way, from the world system called Disturbing the Thistles of Māra, the blessed, thus-gone, worthy, perfect buddha Victorious in Battle,

original: sems dpa' chen po bdud kyi sgrib pa las rnam par rgyal ba zhes bya ba byang chub sems dpa' bye ba khrag khrig 'bum phrag du mas yongs su bskor te mdun du bdar ba nas 'jig rten gyi khams mi mjed 'dir 'ongs te /
analyzed: sems dpa' chen po bdud kyi sgrib pa las rnam par rgyal ba zhes bya ba byang chub sems dpa' bye ba khrag khrig 'bum phrag du mas yongs su bskor te mdun du bdar ba nas 'jig rten gyi khams mi mjed 'dir 'ongs te /
translated: the bodhisattva great being Victorious over Obscurations of Māra, surrounded and followed by many quintillions of bodhisattvas, came to this Sahā world system.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis gnang nas rin po che'i padma'i snying po la 'dug cing /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis gnang nas rin po che'i padma'i snying po la 'dug cing /
translated: With the permission of the Blessed One, he sat on the heart of a precious lotus.

original: rigs kyi bu de dag thams cad kyang chos nyan pa'i phyir de bzhin du rin po che'i padma'i snying po dag la 'khod pa'i bar du'o //
analyzed: rigs kyi bu de dag thams cad kyang chos nyan pa'i phyir de bzhin du rin po che'i padma'i snying po dag la 'khod pa'i bar du'o //
translated: All those sons of noble family also sat on the hearts of precious lotuses in order to listen to the Dharma.

original: de nas @308b de'i tshe stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten gyi khams mi mjed 'dir byang chub sems dpa'i rdzu 'phrul gyi rnam par 'phrul pa du ma bstan pas gzhal med khang dang / me tog gi sprin dang / rin po che'i sprin dang /
analyzed: de nas @308b de'i tshe stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten gyi khams mi mjed 'dir byang chub sems dpa'i rdzu 'phrul gyi rnam par 'phrul pa du ma bstan pas gzhal med khang dang / me tog gi sprin dang / rin po che'i sprin dang /
translated: At that time, this Sahā world realm of a billion worlds was adorned with many bodhisattva miracles, with palaces, clouds of flowers, clouds of jewels,

original: phye ma'i sprin dang / spos dang / gdugs dang / rgyal mtshan dang / ba dan dang / rnam par rgyal ba'i ba dan gyi sprin dang / rin po che'i spug dang / rdo'i snying po dang / bee d'urya dang / aanda snyil dang / byi ru dang /
analyzed: phye ma'i sprin dang / spos dang / gdugs dang / rgyal mtshan dang / ba dan dang / rnam par rgyal ba'i ba dan gyi sprin dang / rin po che'i spug dang / rdo'i snying po dang / bee d'urya dang / aanda snyil dang / byi ru dang /
translated: clouds of powders, clouds of incense, parasols, victory banners, flags, banners of total victory, precious cat’s eyes, precious stones, beryls, sapphires, corals,

original: margad dang / mu tig dmar po dang / 'dzam bu'i chu bo'i gser gyi sprin dang / dpag bsam gyi shing ljon pa dang / rin po che'i padma du mas khebs pa'i gling gis legs par brgyan par gyur to //
analyzed: margad dang / mu tig dmar po dang / 'dzam bu'i chu bo'i gser gyi sprin dang / dpag bsam gyi shing ljon pa dang / rin po che'i padma du mas khebs pa'i gling gis legs par brgyan par gyur to //
translated: marakata, red pearls, and clouds of gold from the Jambū River, and it was well adorned with many wish-fulfilling trees and precious lotuses.

original: 'jig rten gyi khams 'di ji lta ba de bzhin du phyogs bcu'i 'jig rten gyi khams tshad med grangs med bsam gyis mi khyab cing dpag tu med pa gzhal du med cing brjod du med par gtogs pa gang+g'a'i klung gi bye ma snyed las shin tu 'das pa'i
analyzed: 'jig rten gyi khams 'di ji lta ba de bzhin du phyogs bcu'i 'jig rten gyi khams tshad med grangs med bsam gyis mi khyab cing dpag tu med pa gzhal du med cing brjod du med par gtogs pa gang+g'a'i klung gi bye ma snyed las shin tu 'das pa'i
translated: Just as in this world system, so in the ten directions, in the limitless, countless, inconceivable, immeasurable, unfathomable, inexpressible world systems, beyond the sands of the River Ganges,

original: 'jig rten gyi khams dag na gsang ba pa'i bdag po lag na rdo rje'i rnam par thar pa'i sgo chen po'i ting nge 'dzin rnam par 'phrul pa'i byin gyi rlabs kyis de bzhin du legs par brgyan par kun tu snang ngo //
analyzed: 'jig rten gyi khams dag na gsang ba pa'i bdag po lag na rdo rje'i rnam par thar pa'i sgo chen po'i ting nge 'dzin rnam par 'phrul pa'i byin gyi rlabs kyis de bzhin du legs par brgyan par kun tu snang ngo //
translated: in those world systems, the great gate of liberation of Guhyapati Vajrapāṇi, the blessing of the emanation of samādhi, was well-adorned and appeared.

original: 'jig rten gyi khams de dag na de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i @309a *//
analyzed: 'jig rten gyi khams de dag na de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i @309a *//
translated: In those world systems, the tathāgata, arhat, perfectly

original: sangs rgyas gang dag bzhugs te 'tsho zhing gzhes pa de dag thams cad de na bzhugs bzhin du phyag g-yas pa gser gyi kha dog lta bu brkyang ste 'jam zhing mnyen la rab tu gzhom zhing padma dang / yal ga gzhon sha chags shing 'jam pa'i sor mo'i ngos can gdugs dang /
analyzed: sangs rgyas gang dag bzhugs te 'tsho zhing gzhes pa de dag thams cad de na bzhugs bzhin du phyag g-yas pa gser gyi kha dog lta bu brkyang ste 'jam zhing mnyen la rab tu gzhom zhing padma dang / yal ga gzhon sha chags shing 'jam pa'i sor mo'i ngos can gdugs dang /
translated: All the buddhas who are present, living, and remaining in the world extend their right hands, which are the color of gold, smooth, soft, and supple, and whose fingers are like the petals of a lotus, to those who are present there.

original: rgyal mtshan dang / lcags kyu dang / bum pa dang / nya dang / sgo khang dang / gzhal med khang dang / dung dang / rdo rje dang / padma dang / dpal be'u dang / 'khor lo'i mtshan gyis brgyan pa /
analyzed: rgyal mtshan dang / lcags kyu dang / bum pa dang / nya dang / sgo khang dang / gzhal med khang dang / dung dang / rdo rje dang / padma dang / dpal be'u dang / 'khor lo'i mtshan gyis brgyan pa /
translated: They are adorned with the marks of a parasol, a victory banner, a hook, a vase, a fish, a gateway, a palace, a conch, a vajra, a lotus, a swastika, and a wheel.

original: tshe rabs bye ba khrag khrig 'bum phrag du ma nas sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su rdzogs par mdzad pa'i rgyu mthun pas mngon par grub pa'i dpe byad bzang pos rnam par spras pa; sen mo zangs 'dra zhing rgyas la snum zhing srab pa'i nor
analyzed: tshe rabs bye ba khrag khrig 'bum phrag du ma nas sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su rdzogs par mdzad pa'i rgyu mthun pas mngon par grub pa'i dpe byad bzang pos rnam par spras pa; sen mo zangs 'dra zhing rgyas la snum zhing srab pa'i nor
translated: They are adorned with the secondary signs that are the natural result of having perfected the perfection of generosity over many quintillions of lifetimes.

original: bu'i mdongs kyi me tog gi 'od zer gyis mkhrig ma mdzes par gyur pa /
analyzed: bu'i mdongs kyi me tog gi 'od zer gyis mkhrig ma mdzes par gyur pa /
translated: The light rays of the flower of the boy’s eye beautified his wrist.🔽With the hands that give fearlessness to all sentient beings and are in perfect accord, he anointed the lord of secrets Vajrapāṇi, in order to perfectly encourage and delight him.

original: sems can thams cad la mi 'jigs pa sbyin pa dang / yang dag par mthun pa'i phyag rnams kyis gsang ba pa'i bdag po lag na rdo rje la yang dag par gzengs bstod pa dang / yang dag par dga' bar bya ba'i phyir spyi bo las byugs nas dus gcig tu sgra skad kyi nga ro gcig gis 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad go bar mdzad cing 'di skad ces @309b kye rigs kyi bu gang gi phyir bdud sdig can dang /
analyzed: sems can thams cad la mi 'jigs pa sbyin pa dang / yang dag par mthun pa'i phyag rnams kyis gsang ba pa'i bdag po lag na rdo rje la yang dag par gzengs bstod pa dang / yang dag par dga' bar bya ba'i phyir spyi bo las byugs nas dus gcig tu sgra skad kyi nga ro gcig gis 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad go bar mdzad cing 'di skad ces @309b kye rigs kyi bu gang gi phyir bdud sdig can dang /
translated: Simultaneously, with a single sound, he caused all world systems to understand and said, “Oh son of good family, because of the evil Māra

original: gzhan yang de bzhin gshegs pa'i bstan pa la ma dad cing sdang ba'i bgegs dang log 'dren drag shul can drag shul gyi sems dang ldan pa /
analyzed: gzhan yang de bzhin gshegs pa'i bstan pa la ma dad cing sdang ba'i bgegs dang log 'dren drag shul can drag shul gyi sems dang ldan pa /
translated: and others, the obstructors and veils who are hostile and faithless to the teachings of the Tathāgata, the violent ones with violent minds,

original: sems can thams cad kyi dge ba'i rtsa ba gcod pa'i phyir zhugs pa thams cad tshar gcad pa dang / rnam par gzhig pa dang / de bzhin du byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po sems dang po bskyed pa sems zhum pa brtson 'grus brtan po ma yin pa'i go cha bgos pa rnams kyang yang dag par gzengs bstod pa dang /
analyzed: sems can thams cad kyi dge ba'i rtsa ba gcod pa'i phyir zhugs pa thams cad tshar gcad pa dang / rnam par gzhig pa dang / de bzhin du byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po sems dang po bskyed pa sems zhum pa brtson 'grus brtan po ma yin pa'i go cha bgos pa rnams kyang yang dag par gzengs bstod pa dang /
translated: and to destroy all those who have set out to sever the roots of virtue of all sentient beings.🔽In the same way, you should also encourage and delight the bodhisattva great beings who have generated the first level of mind, who are disheartened, who are not firmly diligent, and who have donned the armor.

original: rab tu dga' bar bya ba nas khams gsum par gtogs pa'i sems can thams cad kyi bar dag kyang mya ngan las 'das pa thob par bya ba dang / sangs rgyas dang / chos dang / dge 'dun gyi rigs mi gcod pa'i phyir khyod rdo rje'i rnam par thar pa'i sgo chen po'i ting nge 'dzin bsod nams dang /
analyzed: rab tu dga' bar bya ba nas khams gsum par gtogs pa'i sems can thams cad kyi bar dag kyang mya ngan las 'das pa thob par bya ba dang / sangs rgyas dang / chos dang / dge 'dun gyi rigs mi gcod pa'i phyir khyod rdo rje'i rnam par thar pa'i sgo chen po'i ting nge 'dzin bsod nams dang /
translated: From that point onward, you should cause all sentient beings who belong to the three realms to attain nirvana and to not sever the lineage of the Buddha, the Dharma, and the Saṅgha.

original: ye shes kyi tshogs bsam gyis mi khyab pa bsags pa yongs su rdzogs pas grub pa'i mtshan dang dpe byad bzang pos spras pa /
analyzed: ye shes kyi tshogs bsam gyis mi khyab pa bsags pa yongs su rdzogs pas grub pa'i mtshan dang dpe byad bzang pos spras pa /
translated: He was adorned with the major and minor marks of a buddha, which are the result of the accumulation of the inconceivable collection of wisdom.

original: ting nge 'dzin dang / dbang dang / gzungs dang / stobs dang / byang chub kyi yan lag dang / 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pa'i mthu grub pa /
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin dang / dbang dang / gzungs dang / stobs dang / byang chub kyi yan lag dang / 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pa'i mthu grub pa /
translated: He had accomplished the powers of meditative stabilization, the powers of retention, the powers of strength, the powers of the branches of enlightenment, and the powers of the eightfold noble path.

original: sems can thams cad kyi sdug bsngal dang / nyon mongs pa'i sgrib pa nye bar zhi ba /
analyzed: sems can thams cad kyi sdug bsngal dang / nyon mongs pa'i sgrib pa nye bar zhi ba /
translated: He had pacified the afflictions and the obscurations of all sentient beings.

original: @310a *// sems can dmyal ba dang / dud 'gro'i skye gnas dang / yi dvags dang / gshin rje'i 'jig rten du ltung ba'i 'jigs pa'i dus kyi tsher ma ma lus par 'don pa dang / lha dang / klu dang / gnod sbyin dang / dri za dang /
analyzed: @310a *// sems can dmyal ba dang / dud 'gro'i skye gnas dang / yi dvags dang / gshin rje'i 'jig rten du ltung ba'i 'jigs pa'i dus kyi tsher ma ma lus par 'don pa dang / lha dang / klu dang / gnod sbyin dang / dri za dang /
translated: He had completely extracted the thorns of fear of falling into the hells, the animal realms, the world of hungry ghosts, and the world of Yama.

original: lha ma yin dang / nam mkha' lding dang / mi 'am ci dang / lto 'phye chen po dang / dge slong dang / dge slong ma dang / dge bsnyen dang / dge bsnyen ma la sogs pa'i 'khor mngon par dga' ba can dag la ngo mtshar rmad du byung ba'i dga' ba du ma kun tu skyed pa la snyoms par zhugs pa ni /
analyzed: lha ma yin dang / nam mkha' lding dang / mi 'am ci dang / lto 'phye chen po dang / dge slong dang / dge slong ma dang / dge bsnyen dang / dge bsnyen ma la sogs pa'i 'khor mngon par dga' ba can dag la ngo mtshar rmad du byung ba'i dga' ba du ma kun tu skyed pa la snyoms par zhugs pa ni /
translated: He was in samādhi, generating many kinds of wondrous and marvelous joy for the assemblies of devas, nāgas, yakṣas, gandharvas, asuras, garuḍas, kinnaras, mahoragas, monks, nuns, male and female lay followers, and so forth.

original: legs so legs so zhes bka' stsal to //🔽de ltar sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das de dag gis gsang ba pa'i bdag po lag na rdo rje gzengs bstod de rab tu dga' bar mdzad nas rang rang gis phyag bskum ste rang rang gi byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams chos nyan du gzung ba'i
analyzed: legs so legs so zhes bka' stsal to // de ltar sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das de dag gis gsang ba pa'i bdag po lag na rdo rje gzengs bstod de rab tu dga' bar mdzad nas rang rang gis phyag bskum ste rang rang gi byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams chos nyan du gzung ba'i
translated: “Excellent, excellent!” he said.

original: phyir 'jig rten gyi khams mi mjed 'dir bkye'o //
analyzed: phyir 'jig rten gyi khams mi mjed 'dir bkye'o //
translated: Thus, those buddha bhagavāns praised Vajrapāṇi, lord of guhyakas, and made him extremely happy. Then each of them extended his hand and summoned each of his bodhisattva mahāsattvas to listen to the Dharma in this Sahā world system.

original: de dag gis gnang bas byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de dag thams cad kyis kyang de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas de dag la phyag 'tshal nas byang chub sems dpa'i rnam par 'phrul pa'i byin gyi rlabs chen
analyzed: de dag gis gnang bas byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de dag thams cad kyis kyang de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas de dag la phyag 'tshal nas byang chub sems dpa'i rnam par 'phrul pa'i byin gyi rlabs chen
translated: Through their permission, all those bodhisattva mahāsattvas bowed to those tathāgata arhat samyaksaṃbuddha bhagavāns and then, through the great bodhisattva magical transformation and blessing,

original: po dang / byang chub @310b sems dpa'i rnam par 'phrul pa chen pos ji tsam du skyes bu stobs dang ldan pas lag pa bskum pa las brkyang ba dang / brkyang ba las bskum pa tsam gyi skad cig thang gcig yud tsam de la 'jig rten gyi khams mi mjed der phyin nas bcom ldan 'das kyis gnang ste rin po che'i padma'i snying po dag la phyogs gcig tu 'khod pa'i bar du'o //
analyzed: po dang / byang chub @310b sems dpa'i rnam par 'phrul pa chen pos ji tsam du skyes bu stobs dang ldan pas lag pa bskum pa las brkyang ba dang / brkyang ba las bskum pa tsam gyi skad cig thang gcig yud tsam de la 'jig rten gyi khams mi mjed der phyin nas bcom ldan 'das kyis gnang ste rin po che'i padma'i snying po dag la phyogs gcig tu 'khod pa'i bar du'o //
translated: Having been given permission, all those bodhisattva mahāsattvas bowed to those tathāgatas, arhats, perfectly enlightened buddhas and, by the great blessing of the bodhisattvas’ miraculous powers and the great miraculous power of the bodhisattvas, in that instant, that brief moment, that fraction of a moment, they arrived in the Sahā world realm. Having been given permission by the Blessed One, they sat down on the heart of jeweled lotuses in a single direction.

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas sh'akya thub pas de'i tshe gsang ba pa'i bdag po lag na rdo rje la 'di skad ces bka' stsal to //
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas sh'akya thub pas de'i tshe gsang ba pa'i bdag po lag na rdo rje la 'di skad ces bka' stsal to //
translated: Then the bhagavat, the tathagata, the arhat, the perfectly enlightened buddha Shakyamuni said this to the lord of secrets, Vajrapani:

original: gsang ba pa'i bdag po lag na rdo rje /
analyzed: gsang ba pa'i bdag po lag na rdo rje /
translated: Lord of secrets, Vajrapani,

original: bdud sdig can 'di rdo rje'i zhags pas bcings pa 'di las khrol la ci nas kyang sangs rgyas la skyabs su 'gro bar 'gyur ba dang / chos la skyabs su 'gro bar 'gyur ba dang / dge 'dun la skyabs su 'gro bar 'gyur ba dang /
analyzed: bdud sdig can 'di rdo rje'i zhags pas bcings pa 'di las khrol la ci nas kyang sangs rgyas la skyabs su 'gro bar 'gyur ba dang / chos la skyabs su 'gro bar 'gyur ba dang / dge 'dun la skyabs su 'gro bar 'gyur ba dang /
translated: untie this vajra noose that binds Mara the Wrongdoer, so that he will go for refuge to the Buddha, go for refuge to the Dharma, and go for refuge to the Sangha.

original: gzhan yang gang dag lha dang / klu dang / gnod sbyin dang / dri za dang / lha ma yin dang / nam mkha' lding dang / mi 'am ci dang / lto 'phye chen po dang / mi dang / mi ma yin gang dag ji tsam du de bzhin gshegs pa'i bstan pa la gnas par 'gyur ba dang /
analyzed: gzhan yang gang dag lha dang / klu dang / gnod sbyin dang / dri za dang / lha ma yin dang / nam mkha' lding dang / mi 'am ci dang / lto 'phye chen po dang / mi dang / mi ma yin gang dag ji tsam du de bzhin gshegs pa'i bstan pa la gnas par 'gyur ba dang /
translated: Moreover, whatever gods, nagas, yakshas, gandharvas, asuras, garudas, kinnaras, mahoragas, humans, and non-humans abide in the teachings of the Tathagata,

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i bstan pa la zhugs nas kyang ci nas khong du chud par 'gyur ba de ltar gyis shig /🔽de skad ces bka' stsal pa dang / gsang @311a *//
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i bstan pa la zhugs nas kyang ci nas khong du chud par 'gyur ba de ltar gyis shig / de skad ces bka' stsal pa dang / gsang @311a *//
translated: Having entered the teachings of the Tathāgata, you should do whatever it takes to understand them.”

original: ba pa'i bdag po lag na rdo rjes bcom ldan 'das kyi ltar mnyan nas bcom ldan 'das la legs so legs so //🔽zhes gsol te /
analyzed: ba pa'i bdag po lag na rdo rjes bcom ldan 'das kyi ltar mnyan nas bcom ldan 'das la legs so legs so // zhes gsol te /
translated: When this was said, the Lord of Secrets, Vajrapāṇi, listened to the Bhagavān and said, “Excellent, excellent!

original: bcom ldan 'das kyi zhabs la mgo bos phyag 'tshal nas yang rdo rje'i rnam par thar pa'i sgo chen po'i ting nge 'dzin bdud kyi dkyil 'khor thams cad 'joms par byed pa zhes bya ba la snyoms par zhugs so //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyi zhabs la mgo bos phyag 'tshal nas yang rdo rje'i rnam par thar pa'i sgo chen po'i ting nge 'dzin bdud kyi dkyil 'khor thams cad 'joms par byed pa zhes bya ba la snyoms par zhugs so //
translated: He bowed his head at the Bhagavān’s feet and again entered the meditative absorption called the great vajra liberation door, which destroys all the māra maṇḍalas.

original: gsang ba pa'i bdag po lag na rdo rjes rdo rje'i rnam par thar pa'i sgo chen po'i ting nge 'dzin bdud kyi dkyil 'khor thams cad 'joms par byed pa zhes bya ba la snyoms par zhugs ma thag tu de nas de'i tshe stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i
analyzed: gsang ba pa'i bdag po lag na rdo rjes rdo rje'i rnam par thar pa'i sgo chen po'i ting nge 'dzin bdud kyi dkyil 'khor thams cad 'joms par byed pa zhes bya ba la snyoms par zhugs ma thag tu de nas de'i tshe stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i
translated: The Lord of Secrets, Vajrapāṇi, as soon as he had entered the meditative absorption called “the great gate of vajra liberation, which conquers all the māra maṇḍalas,”

original: 'jig rten gyi khams 'di rnam pa drug tu rab tu g-yos te /
analyzed: 'jig rten gyi khams 'di rnam pa drug tu rab tu g-yos te /
translated: at that time this great trichiliocosm shook in six ways:

original: 'gul / rab tu 'gul /
analyzed: 'gul / rab tu 'gul /
translated: it trembled, trembled strongly,

original: kun tu rab tu 'gul to //🔽chem chem / rab tu chem chem /
analyzed: kun tu rab tu 'gul to // chem chem / rab tu chem chem /
translated: and trembled intensely.🔽It quivered, quivered strongly,

original: kun tu rab tu chem chem mo //
analyzed: kun tu rab tu chem chem mo //
translated: and quivered intensely.

original: gsang ba pa'i bdag po lag na rdo rje yang me lce 'bar ba gcig tu gyur te /🔽'bar / rab tu 'bar /
analyzed: gsang ba pa'i bdag po lag na rdo rje yang me lce 'bar ba gcig tu gyur te / 'bar / rab tu 'bar /
translated: The Lord of Secrets, Vajrapāṇi, became a single blazing mass of fire🔽that blazed, blazed strongly,

original: kun tu rab tu mched cing 'bar te /
analyzed: kun tu rab tu mched cing 'bar te /
translated: and blazed intensely.

original: 'jigs su rung ba'i mche ba rnon po drag po gzengs can 'jigs pa chen po skyed pa gtsigs te mche ba mnan nas me lce chen po ltar sma ra ser zhing 'jigs 'jigs ltar 'dug ste /
analyzed: 'jigs su rung ba'i mche ba rnon po drag po gzengs can 'jigs pa chen po skyed pa gtsigs te mche ba mnan nas me lce chen po ltar sma ra ser zhing 'jigs 'jigs ltar 'dug ste /
translated: With a terrifying, sharp, fierce, and terrifyingly powerful snarl, he bared his fangs and, with a great blazing tongue, his yellow beard was terrifying.

original: mi bzad pa rna ba las 'phyang ba'i sbrul dug 'thor ba dang / @311b ba lang sna lta bu dang / gzar bu lta bu dang / sbrul chen po kha gdangs pa'i kha nas byung ba'i mche ba'i rtse mo nas dug drag po 'bar ba 'byung ba'i tshogs kyi phreng ba bzhin du me 'bar ba /
analyzed: mi bzad pa rna ba las 'phyang ba'i sbrul dug 'thor ba dang / @311b ba lang sna lta bu dang / gzar bu lta bu dang / sbrul chen po kha gdangs pa'i kha nas byung ba'i mche ba'i rtse mo nas dug drag po 'bar ba 'byung ba'i tshogs kyi phreng ba bzhin du me 'bar ba /
translated: The blazing fire of the poison that comes from the mouths of the snakes that hang from their ears, which are like the trunks of elephants, like ladles, and like the mouths of great snakes that are wide open, is like a garland of a series of flames.

original: lag pa stong phrag du ma la rdo rje dang / zhags pa dang / gtun shing dang / gtun shing rked nyag dang / ral gri dang / 'khor lo dang / lcags sgrog la sogs pa thogs pa'i mtshon cha'i rtse mo la me stag rab tu 'phro ba'i snang bas stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten gyi khams kyi khongs su gtogs pa'i gnod sbyin dang /
analyzed: lag pa stong phrag du ma la rdo rje dang / zhags pa dang / gtun shing dang / gtun shing rked nyag dang / ral gri dang / 'khor lo dang / lcags sgrog la sogs pa thogs pa'i mtshon cha'i rtse mo la me stag rab tu 'phro ba'i snang bas stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten gyi khams kyi khongs su gtogs pa'i gnod sbyin dang /
translated: The tips of the weapons that are held in their many thousands of hands—the vajras, the nooses, the pestles, the half-pestles, the swords, the discuses, the iron fetters, and so forth—are blazing with sparks.

original: srin po dang / yi dvags dang / sha za dang / ma mo dang / 'byung po'i gdon dang / bgegs dang / log 'dren la sogs pa sdang ba rab tu sdang ba rab tu sdang ba'i sems can skrag par byed pa ri dvags kyi dbang po'i pags pa khrag dang bcas pa sham thabs su bgos pa /
analyzed: srin po dang / yi dvags dang / sha za dang / ma mo dang / 'byung po'i gdon dang / bgegs dang / log 'dren la sogs pa sdang ba rab tu sdang ba rab tu sdang ba'i sems can skrag par byed pa ri dvags kyi dbang po'i pags pa khrag dang bcas pa sham thabs su bgos pa /
translated: He was wearing a tiger skin, with blood, as a lower garment, terrifying the rākṣasas, pretas, piśācas, mātṛs, bhūta grahas, vighnas, and mārā.

original: sbrul chen po'i lus kyis rgya gram du dam du bcings pa /
analyzed: sbrul chen po'i lus kyis rgya gram du dam du bcings pa /
translated: He was bound with the body of a great snake in a cross pattern.

original: 'jigs pa bas kyang 'jigs par byed pa /
analyzed: 'jigs pa bas kyang 'jigs par byed pa /
translated: He was more terrifying than the terrifying.

original: 'chi bdag kyang skrag par byed pa /
analyzed: 'chi bdag kyang skrag par byed pa /
translated: He was terrifying even to the Lord of Death.🔽He had a body that seemed to encompass all of the three realms.

original: khams gsum pa thams cad kyis bsdus pa lta bu'i lus dang ldan pa'i khro bor gyur nas lus kyi tshigs thams cad las kyang khro bo kha dog du ma 'di lta ste /
analyzed: khams gsum pa thams cad kyis bsdus pa lta bu'i lus dang ldan pa'i khro bor gyur nas lus kyi tshigs thams cad las kyang khro bo kha dog du ma 'di lta ste /
translated: From all the joints of his body, he emitted many wrathful ones of various colors:

original: kha dog sngon po dang / ser po dang / dmar po dang / dkar po dang / nag po ste thams cad kyang rdo rje'i rang @312a *//
analyzed: kha dog sngon po dang / ser po dang / dmar po dang / dkar po dang / nag po ste thams cad kyang rdo rje'i rang @312a *//
translated: blue, yellow, red, white, and black. All of them had vajra

original: bzhin can khro gnyer mi mnyam pas rnam par spras pa'i gnyer ma'i khrem gnyer can gyi dpral ba'i dbyes nas me stag lta bu'i rdul gyi thigs pa rtsub po 'dzag pa las /
analyzed: bzhin can khro gnyer mi mnyam pas rnam par spras pa'i gnyer ma'i khrem gnyer can gyi dpral ba'i dbyes nas me stag lta bu'i rdul gyi thigs pa rtsub po 'dzag pa las /
translated: Her face is distorted with frowns of anger, and from the expanse of her forehead, which is wrinkled with deep furrows, drops of sweat like sparks fall.

original: dug 'chang rnam pa sna tshogs kun tu byung bas yan lag dang / nying lag kun tu dkris pa'i mngon rtags can du gyur cing rdo rje drag shul can du snang ste /
analyzed: dug 'chang rnam pa sna tshogs kun tu byung bas yan lag dang / nying lag kun tu dkris pa'i mngon rtags can du gyur cing rdo rje drag shul can du snang ste /
translated: From these various kinds of poison arise, and she is marked with the signs of their envelopment of all her major and minor body parts. She appears as Vajra Caṇḍālī.

original: mche bas mi bzad par 'dug pa'i kha gdangs pa las ha ha zhes gad mo rta gad 'byung zhing /
analyzed: mche bas mi bzad par 'dug pa'i kha gdangs pa las ha ha zhes gad mo rta gad 'byung zhing /
translated: Her mouth is open in a terrifying gape, and from it comes the sound of “ha ha” laughter.

original: 'jigs pa'i dus kyi rlung gis char pa dang bcas pa'i sprin dkrugs pa las char gyi rgyun rags pa 'bab pas yongs su gang bas rgya mtsho dkrugs nas rlabs chen po g-yo ba dang rta rgod ma'i kha nas me byung ba lta bu'i h'um zhes bya ba zab
analyzed: 'jigs pa'i dus kyi rlung gis char pa dang bcas pa'i sprin dkrugs pa las char gyi rgyun rags pa 'bab pas yongs su gang bas rgya mtsho dkrugs nas rlabs chen po g-yo ba dang rta rgod ma'i kha nas me byung ba lta bu'i h'um zhes bya ba zab
translated: She is like the ocean churned by the wind of the terrifying time of destruction, completely filled with the falling of heavy rain from the churning of the clouds with rain, and with the rising of great waves. She is like a mare’s mouth from which fire arises.🔽She makes the sound of “hum” in a deep,

original: cing brtan pas rgyu ba'i 'byung po'i tshogs 'jigs skrag ste 'byer zhing 'thor nas sdangs te skyabs 'dong zhing 'dud pas /
analyzed: cing brtan pas rgyu ba'i 'byung po'i tshogs 'jigs skrag ste 'byer zhing 'thor nas sdangs te skyabs 'dong zhing 'dud pas /
translated: The host of moving elementals are frightened and terrified. They scatter and flee.🔽When they see the bodies blazing with the light of a thousand suns, they are terrified.

original: nyi ma stong bas 'bar ba'i lus rnams mthong ba na sna sgar sgur can zhom pa lta bu bu ga zab mo'i sbubs kyi nang nas sbrul sna tshogs 'khyil ba'i gtsug gi nor bu'i 'od kyis 'gram pa rnam par mdzes pa /
analyzed: nyi ma stong bas 'bar ba'i lus rnams mthong ba na sna sgar sgur can zhom pa lta bu bu ga zab mo'i sbubs kyi nang nas sbrul sna tshogs 'khyil ba'i gtsug gi nor bu'i 'od kyis 'gram pa rnam par mdzes pa /
translated: The light of the jewel on the top of the head, from the deep cavity of the flat, crooked nose, is beautiful on the cheeks.

original: glog stong 'dus pa ltar ser zhing dmar ba'i mig gi 'bras bu'i 'od zer gyis skra'i tshogs rtsub shing gshor la gyen du 'greng ba'i rtse mo brgyan cing @312b 'dres te gsal bar gyur pa /
analyzed: glog stong 'dus pa ltar ser zhing dmar ba'i mig gi 'bras bu'i 'od zer gyis skra'i tshogs rtsub shing gshor la gyen du 'greng ba'i rtse mo brgyan cing @312b 'dres te gsal bar gyur pa /
translated: The light of the eyes, yellow and red like a thousand flashes of lightning, shines on the rough, bristling hair, which is erect and stands on end.

original: sbrul gyi gdengs ka stong gis gdugs byas shing /
analyzed: sbrul gyi gdengs ka stong gis gdugs byas shing /
translated: A thousand snake hoods form an umbrella.

original: sbrul rnam pa sna tshogs kyi do shal dang / ska rags dang / dpung rgyan dang / gdu bu dang / rna chas lus brgyan pa /
analyzed: sbrul rnam pa sna tshogs kyi do shal dang / ska rags dang / dpung rgyan dang / gdu bu dang / rna chas lus brgyan pa /
translated: The body is adorned with a necklace, belt, armlets, bracelets, and earrings of various snakes.

original: rdo rje 'bar ba dri ma med cing drag shul can /
analyzed: rdo rje 'bar ba dri ma med cing drag shul can /
translated: The blazing vajras are stainless and fierce.

original: mi bzad pa lag na thogs pa /
analyzed: mi bzad pa lag na thogs pa /
translated: They hold them in their hands.

original: mdzub mo rnams las h'um zhes bya ba'i seng+ge'i sgra chen po dag gis bgegs dang / log 'dren thams cad kun tu bsdigs pa dag thon te /
analyzed: mdzub mo rnams las h'um zhes bya ba'i seng+ge'i sgra chen po dag gis bgegs dang / log 'dren thams cad kun tu bsdigs pa dag thon te /
translated: From their fingers, with the sound of “huṃ,” there emerges a great lion’s roar that threatens all the obstructors and misleaders.

original: gang de dag gi mig dang / kha rnams nas gnam grum pa lta bu'i sgra chen po'i tshogs las me lce chen po 'bar ba'i tshogs kyi snang ba byung ste /
analyzed: gang de dag gi mig dang / kha rnams nas gnam grum pa lta bu'i sgra chen po'i tshogs las me lce chen po 'bar ba'i tshogs kyi snang ba byung ste /
translated: From their eyes and mouths, a great sound like thunder emerges, from which a great mass of blazing fire appears.

original: des sdang ba'i bgegs dang / log 'dren la sogs pa drag shul can drag shul gyi sems dang ldan pa /
analyzed: des sdang ba'i bgegs dang / log 'dren la sogs pa drag shul can drag shul gyi sems dang ldan pa /
translated: That burns the fierce obstructors and misleaders, and so forth, who have a fierce mind,

original: sdig ba can sdig pa'i sems dang ldan pa /
analyzed: sdig ba can sdig pa'i sems dang ldan pa /
translated: who are sinful and have a sinful mind,

original: sdang ba can sdang ba'i sems dang ldan pa rnams tshig par byed do //
analyzed: sdang ba can sdang ba'i sems dang ldan pa rnams tshig par byed do //
translated: and who are hateful and have a hateful mind.

original: rmongs par byed do //
analyzed: rmongs par byed do //
translated: It confuses them.

original: 'tshog par byed de /
analyzed: 'tshog par byed de /
translated: It destroys them.

original: mi zad pa drag pa rtsub pa sdug bsngal ba yid du mi 'ong ba'i tshor ba myong bar byed do //
analyzed: mi zad pa drag pa rtsub pa sdug bsngal ba yid du mi 'ong ba'i tshor ba myong bar byed do //
translated: They experience unbearable, fierce, harsh, painful, and unpleasant sensations.

original: de dag tshor bas nyen pas dkon mchog gsum la skyabs su dong ngo //
analyzed: de dag tshor bas nyen pas dkon mchog gsum la skyabs su dong ngo //
translated: They were tormented by pain and went for refuge to the Three Jewels.

original: de'i tshe bdud sdig can gyis bgegs dang / log 'dren de dag tshor ba chen pos nyen te dkon mchog gsum la skyabs su dong ba mthong nas 'jigs sdangs skrag ste skyabs ma rnyed nas rlung drag pos bskyod pa'i shing bzhin du 'dar /
analyzed: de'i tshe bdud sdig can gyis bgegs dang / log 'dren de dag tshor ba chen pos nyen te dkon mchog gsum la skyabs su dong ba mthong nas 'jigs sdangs skrag ste skyabs ma rnyed nas rlung drag pos bskyod pa'i shing bzhin du 'dar /
translated: At that time, the evil Māra saw that those obstructing and misleading beings were tormented by great pain and had gone for refuge to the Three Jewels. He was frightened, terrified, and scared. Not finding any refuge, he trembled like a tree shaken by a strong wind.

original: @313a *// rab tu 'dar te /
analyzed: @313a *// rab tu 'dar te /
translated: He trembled greatly.

original: du bar 'dod na yang du ma nus nas ri mo bzhin du lus thams cad g-yo ba med par gyur to //
analyzed: du bar 'dod na yang du ma nus nas ri mo bzhin du lus thams cad g-yo ba med par gyur to //
translated: Although he wanted to cry, he was unable to. Like a painting, his entire body became motionless.

original: de nas gsang ba ba'i bdag po lag na rdo rje sangs rgyas kyi mthus bdud sdig can 'dul bar byed de sdang ba gdon dang / bgegs dang / log 'dren thams cad dang / bdud kyi dkyil 'khor thams cad 'joms par byed pa /
analyzed: de nas gsang ba ba'i bdag po lag na rdo rje sangs rgyas kyi mthus bdud sdig can 'dul bar byed de sdang ba gdon dang / bgegs dang / log 'dren thams cad dang / bdud kyi dkyil 'khor thams cad 'joms par byed pa /
translated: Then, by the power of the Buddha, Vajrapāṇi, the lord of guhyakas, subdued the evil Māra. He destroyed all the angry spirits, obstructing spirits, misleading spirits, and the entire maṇḍala of Māra.

original: rdo rje'i rnam par thar pa'i sgo chen po'i ting nge 'dzin la snyoms par zhugs te /
analyzed: rdo rje'i rnam par thar pa'i sgo chen po'i ting nge 'dzin la snyoms par zhugs te /
translated: He entered the samādhi called the great vajra gate of liberation.

original: de lta bu'i gzugs su 'dug pa'i rkang pa gnyis las khro bo 'bar zhing 'jigs 'jigs ltar 'dug pa /
analyzed: de lta bu'i gzugs su 'dug pa'i rkang pa gnyis las khro bo 'bar zhing 'jigs 'jigs ltar 'dug pa /
translated: From the feet of that form, two wrathful, blazing, and terrifying beings emerged.

original: drag shul gyi gzugs can /
analyzed: drag shul gyi gzugs can /
translated: They had fierce forms,

original: seng+ge'i sgra chen po h'um zhes bya ba 'di gnyis phyung ste /
analyzed: seng+ge'i sgra chen po h'um zhes bya ba 'di gnyis phyung ste /
translated: and they roared out a great lion's roar, hum!

original: de gnyis skar mda' bzhin du nam mkha'i dkyil du rgyang ring du 'phur te nam mkha' la gnas pa'i shugs kyis bcom ldan 'das de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas sh'akya thub pa la lan 'bum phrag du ma mtha' yas mu🔽med par bskor ba byas te gsang ba pa'i bdag po lag na rdo rje la 'di skad ces smras so //
analyzed: de gnyis skar mda' bzhin du nam mkha'i dkyil du rgyang ring du 'phur te nam mkha' la gnas pa'i shugs kyis bcom ldan 'das de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas sh'akya thub pa la lan 'bum phrag du ma mtha' yas mu med par bskor ba byas te gsang ba pa'i bdag po lag na rdo rje la 'di skad ces smras so //
translated: Those two flew far into the sky like shooting stars. They circled the blessed, thus-gone, worthy, perfect Buddha Shakyamuni in the sky countless hundreds of thousands of times.

original: rigs kyi bu ci bgyi bka' stsol cig /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu ci bgyi bka' stsol cig /
translated: Then they said to the lord of secrets, Vajrapani, What can we do, son of noble family? Give us your command!

original: de nas gsang ba pa'i bdag po lag na rdo rje cang mi smra bar 'dug ste /
analyzed: de nas gsang ba pa'i bdag po lag na rdo rje cang mi smra bar 'dug ste /
translated: Then the lord of secrets, Vajrapani, remained silent.

original: yang dpral ba'i dkyil nas rdo rje khro bo 'jigs pa chen po'i gzugs @313b mche ba mi bzad pa drag pas 'jigs su rungs pa'i kha gdangs te mchu ma rungs par bsgyur ba'i kha nas dus kyi tha ma 'jig pa'i tshe rnam par 'thor ba'i rlung drag po'i
analyzed: yang dpral ba'i dkyil nas rdo rje khro bo 'jigs pa chen po'i gzugs @313b mche ba mi bzad pa drag pas 'jigs su rungs pa'i kha gdangs te mchu ma rungs par bsgyur ba'i kha nas dus kyi tha ma 'jig pa'i tshe rnam par 'thor ba'i rlung drag po'i
translated: From the mouth, at the time of the end of the age, a great wind blows,

original: shugs kyis rab tu bskyod pa'i sprin nag po'i tshogs rab tu sgrog pas rnam par dkrugs pa'i rgya mtsho chen po'i sgra drag po lta bu'i h'um zhes bya ba'i seng+ge'i sgras gang ba /
analyzed: shugs kyis rab tu bskyod pa'i sprin nag po'i tshogs rab tu sgrog pas rnam par dkrugs pa'i rgya mtsho chen po'i sgra drag po lta bu'i h'um zhes bya ba'i seng+ge'i sgras gang ba /
translated: shaking a mass of black clouds with the sound of a great ocean churned by a violent wind.

original: bgegs dang log 'dren thams cad 'jigs nas 'bros shing sgyid lug nas phyogs bslad par byed pa /
analyzed: bgegs dang log 'dren thams cad 'jigs nas 'bros shing sgyid lug nas phyogs bslad par byed pa /
translated: It is filled with the lion’s roar of hūṃ, which terrifies all obstructors and misleaders, causing them to flee, become disheartened, and turn away.

original: lag pa dang / rkang pa dang / sen mo dang / mig dang / aag tshom dang / skra thams cad rdo rje 'bar bar snang bas stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad rgyas par 'gengs pa gzi brjid thams cad kyi gzi brjid rnams rang gi gzi brjid kyis zil tu brlag par byed cing /
analyzed: lag pa dang / rkang pa dang / sen mo dang / mig dang / aag tshom dang / skra thams cad rdo rje 'bar bar snang bas stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad rgyas par 'gengs pa gzi brjid thams cad kyi gzi brjid rnams rang gi gzi brjid kyis zil tu brlag par byed cing /
translated: The blazing vajras that appear in all his hands, feet, nails, eyes, moles, and hair fill the entire trichiliocosm with their brilliance, outshining the brilliance of all brilliant things.

original: rgyang ring du byed pa'i rdo rje 'bar ba'i snang ba des rgyu skar dang / gza' dang / skar ma dang / nor bu rnams kyi 'od lham mer ma yin /
analyzed: rgyang ring du byed pa'i rdo rje 'bar ba'i snang ba des rgyu skar dang / gza' dang / skar ma dang / nor bu rnams kyi 'od lham mer ma yin /
translated: The blazing vajra light that extends far away makes the light of the stars, planets, and jewels not shine,

original: lhan ner ma yin /
analyzed: lhan ner ma yin /
translated: not be radiant,

original: lhang nger ma yin par byed pa /
analyzed: lhang nger ma yin par byed pa /
translated: and not be clear.

original: gang nyi ma dang / zla ba rdzu 'phrul che ba /
analyzed: gang nyi ma dang / zla ba rdzu 'phrul che ba /
translated: The light of the sun and moon, which are of great magic power,

original: dbang che bar grags pa mthu che ba yang lham mer ma yin /
analyzed: dbang che bar grags pa mthu che ba yang lham mer ma yin /
translated: great power, and great fame, does not shine

original: lhan ner ma yin par byed pa /
analyzed: lhan ner ma yin par byed pa /
translated: and is not radiant.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i 'od dang / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po sa bcu la rab tu gnas pa rnams kyi 'od ma gtogs @314a *//
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i 'od dang / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po sa bcu la rab tu gnas pa rnams kyi 'od ma gtogs @314a *//
translated: except for the light of the Tathāgatas and the light of the bodhisattva mahāsattvas who are established in the ten stages.

original: par 'od gzhan thams cad 'od mog mog por byed pa gzhan byung ngo //🔽de nas rdo rje khro bo des bcom ldan 'das de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas sh'akya thub pa la lan 'bum phrag du ma mtha' yas mu med par bskor ba byas te bcom ldan 'das kyis gnang nas gsang ba pa'i
analyzed: par 'od gzhan thams cad 'od mog mog por byed pa gzhan byung ngo // de nas rdo rje khro bo des bcom ldan 'das de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas sh'akya thub pa la lan 'bum phrag du ma mtha' yas mu med par bskor ba byas te bcom ldan 'das kyis gnang nas gsang ba pa'i
translated: All other lights were eclipsed by that light.

original: bdag po lag na rdo rje la 'di skad ces smras so //
analyzed: bdag po lag na rdo rje la 'di skad ces smras so //
translated: Then that Vajra Wrath, having circumambulated the Blessed One, the Tathāgata, the Arhat, the Perfectly Awakened Buddha Śākyamuni, countless hundreds of thousands of times, and having received permission from the Blessed One, said this to the Lord of Secrets🔽Vajrapāṇi:

original: rigs kyi bu /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu /
translated: Son of noble family,

original: ci bgyi bka' stsol cig /
analyzed: ci bgyi bka' stsol cig /

analyzed: de nas gsang ba pa'i bdag po lag na rdo rjes khro bo chen po rdo rje khro bo de dag la 'di skad ces smras so //
translated: Then the Lord of Secrets, Vajrapāṇi, said this to those great wrathful Vajra Wrath deities:

original: skyes bu dam pa dag /
analyzed: skyes bu dam pa dag /

analyzed: deng la bdud sdig can dkon mchog gsum la skyabs su 'dzin du chug cig /

original: 'di dam tshig la gnas par gyis shig /
analyzed: 'di dam tshig la gnas par gyis shig /

original: gzhan yang gang dag sdang ba gdon dang / bgegs dang / log 'dren la sogs pa drag shul drag shul gyi sems dang ldan pa; sdig pa can sdig pa'i sems dang ldan pa /🔽sdang ba can sdang ba'i sems dang ldan pa dag dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i bstan pa la mi 'jug pa dang / mi rtogs pa dang / yid mi ches pa thams cad de bzhin gshegs pa'i bstan pa la gnas par gyis shig dang / des sems can thams cad kyi yun ring po'i @314b don dang /
analyzed: gzhan yang gang dag sdang ba gdon dang / bgegs dang / log 'dren la sogs pa drag shul drag shul gyi sems dang ldan pa; sdig pa can sdig pa'i sems dang ldan pa / sdang ba can sdang ba'i sems dang ldan pa dag dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i bstan pa la mi 'jug pa dang / mi rtogs pa dang / yid mi ches pa thams cad de bzhin gshegs pa'i bstan pa la gnas par gyis shig dang / des sems can thams cad kyi yun ring po'i @314b don dang /
translated: sinful with sinful thoughts,🔽and hostile with hostile thoughts, as well as all those who do not enter, understand, or have faith in the teachings of the Tathāgata—let them abide by the teachings of the Tathāgata,

original: phan pa dang / bde bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: phan pa dang / bde bar 'gyur ro //
translated: for that will be for the long-term benefit, welfare, and happiness of all beings.

original: de skad ces smras pa dang / khro bo chen po rdo rje khro bo de dag gis gsang ba pa'i bdag po lag na rdo rje'i tshig mnyan nas de bzhin gshegs pa'i bstan pa yang bzung ste dus gcig tu sgra skad kyi nga ro gcig tu seng+ge'i sgra chen po h'um zhes bya bas stong
analyzed: de skad ces smras pa dang / khro bo chen po rdo rje khro bo de dag gis gsang ba pa'i bdag po lag na rdo rje'i tshig mnyan nas de bzhin gshegs pa'i bstan pa yang bzung ste dus gcig tu sgra skad kyi nga ro gcig tu seng+ge'i sgra chen po h'um zhes bya bas stong
translated: Having listened to the words of Guhyapati Vajrapāṇi, those wrathful vajra wrathful ones also upheld the teachings of the tathāgatas and with a single sound and voice, with the great lion’s roar of hūṃ, they shook the entire realm of the trichiliocosm.🔽

original: gsum gyi stong chen bo'i 'jig rten gyi khams rgyas par 'gengs shing /
analyzed: gsum gyi stong chen bo'i 'jig rten gyi khams rgyas par 'gengs shing /
translated: Having heard the words of Vajrapāṇi, Lord of Secrets, those great wrathful vajra wrathful ones accepted the teachings of the Tathāgata and with a single voice, a great lion's roar of hum, they filled the trichiliocosm with a great sound.

original: gsang sngags kyi gzhi 'di dag smras so //
analyzed: gsang sngags kyi gzhi 'di dag smras so //

analyzed: sangs rgyas la phyag 'tshal lo //

analyzed: dge 'dun la phyag 'tshal lo //

analyzed: yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas dang / byang chub sems dpa'i dge 'dun dang bcas pa bdun po dag la phyag 'tshal lo //
