original: khyed kyis dang phan chad sems can gang dag de bzhin gshegs pa'i bstan par zhugs pa dag dang / de la @321b sogs pa gang dag gsang sngags sgrub bam /
analyzed: khyed kyis dang phan chad sems can gang dag de bzhin gshegs pa'i bstan par zhugs pa dag dang / de la @321b sogs pa gang dag gsang sngags sgrub bam /
translated: You should not create obstacles or harm those who have entered the teachings of the Tathāgata,

original: klog pa de dag la bgegs 'byung bar mi bya zhing 'che bar mi bya ste /
analyzed: klog pa de dag la bgegs 'byung bar mi bya zhing 'che bar mi bya ste /
translated: or those who are practicing or reciting the mantra, and so forth.🔽You should give them strength in accordance with their practice.

original: sgrub pa dang rjes su mthun par stobs sbyin par bya'o; ;sems can gang dag dam tshig la ma zhugs pa de dag la bsrung bar bya /
analyzed: sgrub pa dang rjes su mthun par stobs sbyin par bya'o; ;sems can gang dag dam tshig la ma zhugs pa de dag la bsrung bar bya /
translated: You should protect those sentient beings who have not entered the commitments.

original: zhi ba dang / bde legs su 'gyur ba dang / chad pa spang ba dang / dug gzhil ba dang / dug bsad pa dang / rig sngags 'grub par sbyin par bya'o //
analyzed: zhi ba dang / bde legs su 'gyur ba dang / chad pa spang ba dang / dug gzhil ba dang / dug bsad pa dang / rig sngags 'grub par sbyin par bya'o //
translated: You should give them peace, well-being, freedom from punishment, the antidote to poison, the killing of poison, and the accomplishment of mantras.

original: sbrang rtsi dang / tshigs ma dang / sgog pa dang / ke'u dang / gtor ma dang / 'byung po dang / mi bgrungs pa rnams kyi sha dang zas zos kyang skyon du  mi gzung zhing nyes par mi brtsi'o //
analyzed: sbrang rtsi dang / tshigs ma dang / sgog pa dang / ke'u dang / gtor ma dang / 'byung po dang / mi bgrungs pa rnams kyi sha dang zas zos kyang skyon du  mi gzung zhing nyes par mi brtsi'o //
translated: You should not consider as faults or misdeeds eating honey, grains, garlic, onions, bali offerings, or the flesh and food of spirits and demons.

original: de nas sdang ba 'byung po dang / bgegs dang / log 'dren la sogs pa thams cad ces bya ba nas sgra skad kyi nga ro gcig gis 'di skad ces smras so zhes bya ba'i bar du sbyar ro //
analyzed: de nas sdang ba 'byung po dang / bgegs dang / log 'dren la sogs pa thams cad ces bya ba nas sgra skad kyi nga ro gcig gis 'di skad ces smras so zhes bya ba'i bar du sbyar ro //
translated: Then, all the angry spirits, obstructors, and misleaders, and so forth, with a single voice, said this:

original: rigs kyi bu dag /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu dag /
translated: “Sons of good family!

original: bka' lung ci stsal ba de bzhin du sbyar bar bgyi'o //
analyzed: bka' lung ci stsal ba de bzhin du sbyar bar bgyi'o //
translated: We will apply ourselves to whatever the command is.”

original: deng slan chad sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das dang / chos dang / dge 'dun la skyabs su mchi'o //
analyzed: deng slan chad sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das dang / chos dang / dge 'dun la skyabs su mchi'o //
translated: From now on, we go for refuge to the Blessed Buddha, the Dharma, and the Saṅgha.

original: sems can thams cad kyi don du bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu sems bskyed do //🔽de nas gsang ba pa'i bdag po lag na rdo rjes khro bo chen po rdo rje khro bo chen po dag dang / sdang ba bgegs dang / log 'dren dang / 'byung po @322a *//
analyzed: sems can thams cad kyi don du bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu sems bskyed do // de nas gsang ba pa'i bdag po lag na rdo rjes khro bo chen po rdo rje khro bo chen po dag dang / sdang ba bgegs dang / log 'dren dang / 'byung po @322a *//
translated: We arouse the mind of awakening for the sake of all sentient beings, for the sake of unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening.🔽Then, the lord of guhyakas, Vajrapāṇi, gave his approval to all those hosts of angry spirits, obstructors, misleaders, and bhūta grahas:

original: dang / gdon gyi tshogs de dag thams cad la legs so zhes bya ba byin te /
analyzed: dang / gdon gyi tshogs de dag thams cad la legs so zhes bya ba byin te /
translated: “Excellent!

original: rig sngags kyi las dang / dam tshig dang / phyag rgya thams cad 'dzin du bcu go /
analyzed: rig sngags kyi las dang / dam tshig dang / phyag rgya thams cad 'dzin du bcu go /
translated: He caused all the activities of the vidyā-mantras, the samayas, and the mudrās to be upheld.

original: gsang ba pa'i bdag po lag na rdo rje yang rdo rje'i rnam par thar pa'i sgo chen po'i ting nge 'dzin de las langs so //
analyzed: gsang ba pa'i bdag po lag na rdo rje yang rdo rje'i rnam par thar pa'i sgo chen po'i ting nge 'dzin de las langs so //
translated: Vajrapāṇi, the lord of guhyakas, arose from that samādhi called the great vajra liberation gateway.

original: de nas tshe dang ldan pa sha radv'a ti'i bus gsang ba pa'i bdag po lag na rdo rje la 'di skad ces smras so //
analyzed: de nas tshe dang ldan pa sha radv'a ti'i bus gsang ba pa'i bdag po lag na rdo rje la 'di skad ces smras so //
translated: Then Venerable Śāradvatīputra said to Vajrapāṇi, the lord of guhyakas:

original: rigs kyi bu /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu /
translated: “Son of noble family,

original: gang la gnas nas khyed kyis rdzu 'phrul gyi cho 'phrul 'di lta bu 'di bstan pam dang / bdud sdig can yang byang chub tu sems bskyed pa dang / gzhan yang sdang ba gdon dang / 'byung po dang / bgegs dang / log 'dren thams cad dam tshig la bkod cing byang chub kyi sems 'dzin du bcug pa'i ting nge 'dzin 'di'i ming ci zhes bya /
analyzed: gang la gnas nas khyed kyis rdzu 'phrul gyi cho 'phrul 'di lta bu 'di bstan pam dang / bdud sdig can yang byang chub tu sems bskyed pa dang / gzhan yang sdang ba gdon dang / 'byung po dang / bgegs dang / log 'dren thams cad dam tshig la bkod cing byang chub kyi sems 'dzin du bcug pa'i ting nge 'dzin 'di'i ming ci zhes bya /
translated: what is the name of the samādhi in which you remained in order to display such a miraculous transformation, to cause Māra, the evil one, to arouse the mind of awakening, and to cause all the hostile grahas, bhūtas, vighnas, and piśācas to be bound by oath and to uphold the mind of awakening?”

original: de skad ces smras pa dang / gsang ba pa'i bdag po lag na rdo rjes tshe dang ldan pa sh'a radva ti'i bu la 'di skad ces smras so //
analyzed: de skad ces smras pa dang / gsang ba pa'i bdag po lag na rdo rjes tshe dang ldan pa sh'a radva ti'i bu la 'di skad ces smras so //
translated: The Lord of Secrets, Vajrapāṇi, said to the venerable Śāradvatīputra,

original: btsun pa sh'a radva ti'i bu /🔽ting nge 'dzin 'di ni /
analyzed: btsun pa sh'a radva ti'i bu / ting nge 'dzin 'di ni /
translated: “Venerable Śāradvatīputra,

original: ming dang / yi ge dang / sgra skad kyis rtogs par bya ba ma yin no //
analyzed: ming dang / yi ge dang / sgra skad kyis rtogs par bya ba ma yin no //
translated: this meditative absorption is not to be realized through names, syllables, or sounds.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?🔽There is no such thing as a phenomenon called ‘meditative absorption’

original: gang ming ngam /
analyzed: gang ming ngam /
translated: that has a name,

original: gzugs sam / dbyibs sam /🔽gnas sam / mnyam par gzhag pa'am /
analyzed: gzugs sam / dbyibs sam / gnas sam / mnyam par gzhag pa'am /
translated: a form, a shape,🔽a location, a state of composure,

original: g-yeng ba yang rung ste /🔽ting nge 'dzin ces bya ba'i chos de gang yang med do //
analyzed: g-yeng ba yang rung ste / ting nge 'dzin ces bya ba'i chos de gang yang med do //
translated: or a state of distraction.

original: @322b gang la ming med pa dang / gzugs med pa dang / dbyibs med pa dang / gnas med pa dang / mnyam par gzhag pa med pa dang / g-yeng ba med pa 'di btsun pa sh'a radva ti'i bu ting nge 'dzin 'di'i ming ci zhes bya zhes de la ji snyam du sems /
analyzed: @322b gang la ming med pa dang / gzugs med pa dang / dbyibs med pa dang / gnas med pa dang / mnyam par gzhag pa med pa dang / g-yeng ba med pa 'di btsun pa sh'a radva ti'i bu ting nge 'dzin 'di'i ming ci zhes bya zhes de la ji snyam du sems /
translated: Venerable Śāradvatīputra, what is the name of this meditative absorption, which has no name, no form, no shape, no location, no state of composure, and no state of distraction?”

original: yang btsun pa sh'a radva ti'i bu /
analyzed: yang btsun pa sh'a radva ti'i bu /
translated: “Venerable Śāradvatīputra,

original: gsal bar byed pa 'di ni /
analyzed: gsal bar byed pa 'di ni /
translated: This illumination

original: bdag la gsal par byed pa ma yin /🔽gzhan la gsal bar byed pa ma yin /
analyzed: bdag la gsal par byed pa ma yin / gzhan la gsal bar byed pa ma yin /
translated: is not an illumination of self,🔽nor is it an illumination of other,

original: gnyi ga la gsal bar byed pa ma yin no //
analyzed: gnyi ga la gsal bar byed pa ma yin no //
translated: nor is it an illumination of both.

original: 'on kyang gsal bar byed par btags pa yod do //🔽de la gsal bar byed pa ni /
analyzed: 'on kyang gsal bar byed par btags pa yod do // de la gsal bar byed pa ni /
translated: Nevertheless, the designation “illumination” exists.

original: gsal bar byed pa'i bdag nyid kyis stong /
analyzed: gsal bar byed pa'i bdag nyid kyis stong /
translated: In this regard, illumination is empty of the nature of illumination.

original: bdag ni / bdag gis stong /🔽gzhan yang gzhan gyi bdag nyid kyis stong /
analyzed: bdag ni / bdag gis stong / gzhan yang gzhan gyi bdag nyid kyis stong /
translated: Self is empty of self.🔽Other is empty of the nature of other.

original: gnyi ga yang gnyi ga'i bdag nyid kyis stong ste /
analyzed: gnyi ga yang gnyi ga'i bdag nyid kyis stong ste /
translated: Both are empty of the nature of both.

original: yang dag pa ma yin pa kun tu btags pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yang dag pa ma yin pa kun tu btags pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because of the imputation of what is not real.

original: 'di ci zhes bya ba'i yi ge gnyis kyi tshig kyang tshig gis bdag nyid kyis stong ste /
analyzed: 'di ci zhes bya ba'i yi ge gnyis kyi tshig kyang tshig gis bdag nyid kyis stong ste /
translated: The two syllables “ci” and “da” are also empty of the nature of syllables.

original: yi ge yang yi ge ma yin no //
analyzed: yi ge yang yi ge ma yin no //
translated: A syllable is not a syllable.

original: de ltar na rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'i don rtogs par byed pa yin no //
analyzed: de ltar na rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'i don rtogs par byed pa yin no //
translated: Thus, one should understand the meaning of dependent origination.

original: don de brjod pa na yang gang nas kyang mi 'ong /
analyzed: don de brjod pa na yang gang nas kyang mi 'ong /
translated: When that meaning is expressed, it does not come from anywhere,

original: gang du yang mi 'gro mod kyi /
analyzed: gang du yang mi 'gro mod kyi /
translated: and it does not go anywhere.

original: gzhan gyi dbang la brten pa'i phyir yi ger btags pa yang yod do //
analyzed: gzhan gyi dbang la brten pa'i phyir yi ger btags pa yang yod do //
translated: There is also the designation of syllables because of dependence on the other-dependent.

original: yongs su btags pa yin pa'i phyir btags pa yang stong pa'o //🔽rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba'i phyir gzhan gyi @323a *//
analyzed: yongs su btags pa yin pa'i phyir btags pa yang stong pa'o // rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba'i phyir gzhan gyi @323a *//
translated: The imaginary is empty because of being imaginary.

original: dbang nyid stong pa'o //
analyzed: dbang nyid stong pa'o //
translated: The other-dependent is empty because of being dependently arisen.

original: rgyu dang rkyen las byung ba'i phyir rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba yang stong pa'o //
analyzed: rgyu dang rkyen las byung ba'i phyir rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba yang stong pa'o //
translated: The dependently arisen is empty because of arising in dependence on causes and conditions.

original: glo bur du rgyu dang rkyen gyis bskyed pa'i phyir 'byung ba'i bdag nyid kyis stong ngo //
analyzed: glo bur du rgyu dang rkyen gyis bskyed pa'i phyir 'byung ba'i bdag nyid kyis stong ngo //
translated: The nature of the elements is empty because of being produced by adventitious causes and conditions.

original: de la rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba ni /
analyzed: de la rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba ni /
translated: In this regard, the dependently arisen

original: rang gi mtshan nyid kyis stong ngo //
analyzed: rang gi mtshan nyid kyis stong ngo //
translated: is empty of its own characteristic.

original: rang gi mtshan nyid stong pa gang yin pa de mtshan nyid med pa'o //
analyzed: rang gi mtshan nyid stong pa gang yin pa de mtshan nyid med pa'o //
translated: That which is empty of its own characteristic is without characteristic.

original: mtshan nyid med pa gang yin pa de de bzhin nyid do //
analyzed: mtshan nyid med pa gang yin pa de de bzhin nyid do //
translated: That which is without characteristic is suchness.

original: de bzhin nyid gang yin pa de ma nor ba de bzhin nyid do //
analyzed: de bzhin nyid gang yin pa de ma nor ba de bzhin nyid do //
translated: That which is suchness is unmistaken suchness.

original: ma nor ba de bzhin nyid gang yin pa de gzhan ma yin pa de gzhin nyid do //
analyzed: ma nor ba de bzhin nyid gang yin pa de gzhan ma yin pa de gzhin nyid do //
translated: The nonerroneous suchness is the suchness that is not other.

original: gzhan ma yin pa de bzhin nyid gang yin pa de ting nge 'dzin to //
analyzed: gzhan ma yin pa de bzhin nyid gang yin pa de ting nge 'dzin to //
translated: The suchness that is not other is samādhi.

original: ting nge 'dzin gang yin pa de rtogs pa'o //🔽rtogs pa gang yin pa de stong pa nyid do //
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin gang yin pa de rtogs pa'o // rtogs pa gang yin pa de stong pa nyid do //
translated: Samādhi is realization.🔽Realization is emptiness.

original: stong pa nyid gang yin pa de lhag mthong ngo //🔽lhag mthong gang yin pa de zhi gnas so //
analyzed: stong pa nyid gang yin pa de lhag mthong ngo // lhag mthong gang yin pa de zhi gnas so //
translated: Emptiness is vipaśyanā.🔽Vipaśyanā is śamatha.

original: zhi gnas gang yin pa de rnam par thar pa'o //
analyzed: zhi gnas gang yin pa de rnam par thar pa'o //
translated: Śamatha is liberation.

original: rnam par thar pa gang yin pa de dbu ma'i lam yin no //
analyzed: rnam par thar pa gang yin pa de dbu ma'i lam yin no //
translated: Liberation is the middle way.

original: dbu ma'i lam gang yin pa de la mtha' gcig med /
analyzed: dbu ma'i lam gang yin pa de la mtha' gcig med /
translated: The middle way has no one extreme.

original: mtha' gnyis med /🔽gzung ba med /🔽'dzin pa po med /
analyzed: mtha' gnyis med / gzung ba med / 'dzin pa po med /
translated: It has no two extremes.🔽It has no apprehended object.🔽It has no apprehending subject.

original: 'dzin pa med /
analyzed: 'dzin pa med /
translated: It has no grasping.

original: chad pa med /
analyzed: chad pa med /
translated: It has no annihilation.

original: rtag pa med /
analyzed: rtag pa med /
translated: It has no permanence.

original: skye ba med /
analyzed: skye ba med /
translated: It has no arising.

original: 'gag pa med /🔽rtog pa med /
analyzed: 'gag pa med / rtog pa med /
translated: It has no ceasing.🔽It has no thought.

original: rnam par rtog pa med /
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa med /
translated: It has no discursive thought.

original: rang dbang med /
analyzed: rang dbang med /
translated: It has no independence.

original: gzhan gyi dbang med /🔽'gro ba med /
analyzed: gzhan gyi dbang med / 'gro ba med /
translated: It has no dependence on another.🔽It has no going.

original: 'ong ba med /
analyzed: 'ong ba med /
translated: It has no coming.

original: kun @323b nas nyon mongs pa med /
analyzed: kun @323b nas nyon mongs pa med /
translated: There is no affliction,

original: rnam par byang ba med /
analyzed: rnam par byang ba med /
translated: no purification,

original: 'du ba med /
analyzed: 'du ba med /
translated: no coming together,

original: 'bral ba med do //
analyzed: 'bral ba med do //
translated: and no separation.

original: de ni / lhag mthong yin no //
analyzed: de ni / lhag mthong yin no //
translated: This is vipaśyanā.

original: lhag mthong gang yin ba de la phung po med /🔽khams rnams med; dbang po rnams med /
analyzed: lhag mthong gang yin ba de la phung po med / khams rnams med; dbang po rnams med /
translated: In vipaśyanā there are no aggregates,

original: skye mched rnams med /🔽yul rnams med /
analyzed: skye mched rnams med / yul rnams med /
translated: no constituents,🔽no sense sources,🔽no objects,

original: yul du gdags pa med /
analyzed: yul du gdags pa med /
translated: no designation of objects,

original: las med / las kyi 'bras bu med do //
analyzed: las med / las kyi 'bras bu med do //
translated: no karma, and no results of karma.

original: gang la las med cing las kyi 'bras bu med pa de bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub bo //
analyzed: gang la las med cing las kyi 'bras bu med pa de bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub bo //
translated: Where there is no karma and no results of karma, that is unsurpassed perfect complete awakening.

original: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub gang yin pa de bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas so //
analyzed: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub gang yin pa de bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas so //
translated: That which is unsurpassed perfect complete awakening is the unsurpassed perfect complete Buddha.

original: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas gang yin pa de chos so //
analyzed: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas gang yin pa de chos so //
translated: That which is the unsurpassed perfect complete Buddha is the Dharma.

original: chos gang yin pa de mi skye mi 'chi'o //
analyzed: chos gang yin pa de mi skye mi 'chi'o //
translated: That which is the Dharma does not arise and does not cease.

original: mi skye mi 'chi ba gang yin pa de nam mkha' dang mnyam pa nyid du khong du chud par bya'o //🔽btsun pa sha radv'a ti'i bus smras pa /
analyzed: mi skye mi 'chi ba gang yin pa de nam mkha' dang mnyam pa nyid du khong du chud par bya'o // btsun pa sha radv'a ti'i bus smras pa /
translated: One should understand that which is neither born nor dies to be the same as space.🔽Venerable Śāradvatīputra said:

original: rigs kyi bu /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu /
translated: “Noble sir,

original: khyod kyis ting nge 'dzin bstan pa 'di ni /
analyzed: khyod kyis ting nge 'dzin bstan pa 'di ni /
translated: this teaching of yours on meditative absorption

original: shin tu zab ste /
analyzed: shin tu zab ste /
translated: is very profound.

original: 'di la nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas thams cad kyi 'gro ba yang med na /
analyzed: 'di la nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas thams cad kyi 'gro ba yang med na /
translated: If even the disciples and the solitary sages have no access to it,

original: 'jig rten pa'i mu stegs can dang / phas kyi rgol ba thams cad lta smos kyang ci dgos /
analyzed: 'jig rten pa'i mu stegs can dang / phas kyi rgol ba thams cad lta smos kyang ci dgos /
translated: what need is there to speak of all the mundane tīrthikas and adversaries?

original: chos kyi rnam grangs 'di ni /
analyzed: chos kyi rnam grangs 'di ni /
translated: This Dharma discourse

original: dge ba'i rtsa ba ma bskyed pa dang / mos pa chung ba thams cad kyis shes par dka' ba ste /
analyzed: dge ba'i rtsa ba ma bskyed pa dang / mos pa chung ba thams cad kyis shes par dka' ba ste /
translated: is difficult for anyone who has not planted the roots of virtue or who has little interest to understand.

original: gzhan du na 'di de bzhin gshegs pa'i spyan gyi yul du @324a *//🔽gyur pa ni /
analyzed: gzhan du na 'di de bzhin gshegs pa'i spyan gyi yul du @324a *// gyur pa ni /
translated: It is only an object of the vision of the Tathāgata.

original: ma gtogs so //
analyzed: ma gtogs so //
translated: It is not otherwise.

original: de la de bzhin gshegs pa'i spyan ni /🔽dmigs pa med pa /
analyzed: de la de bzhin gshegs pa'i spyan ni / dmigs pa med pa /
translated: The vision of the Tathāgata🔽is without reference point

original: gnas pa med pa'o //
analyzed: gnas pa med pa'o //
translated: and without location.

original: de skad ces smras pa dang / gsang ba pa'i bdag po lag na rdo rjes tshe dang ldan pa sha radv'a ti'i bu la 'di skad ces smras so //
analyzed: de skad ces smras pa dang / gsang ba pa'i bdag po lag na rdo rjes tshe dang ldan pa sha radv'a ti'i bu la 'di skad ces smras so //
translated: The Lord of Secrets, Vajrapāṇi, said to the venerable Śāradvatīputra,

original: btsun pa sha radv'a ti'i bu /
analyzed: btsun pa sha radv'a ti'i bu /
translated: “Venerable Śāradvatīputra,

original: de bzhin gshegs pa zhes bya de ni /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa zhes bya de ni /
translated: the so-called tathāgata

original: de bzhin nyid kyi mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: de bzhin nyid kyi mtshan nyid do //
translated: is the characteristic of suchness.

original: stong pa nyid gang yin pa de la de bzhin gshegs pa med do //
analyzed: stong pa nyid gang yin pa de la de bzhin gshegs pa med do //
translated: In emptiness there is no tathāgata.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i mtshan nyid med do //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i mtshan nyid med do //
translated: There is no characteristic of a tathāgata.

original: sha radv'a ti'i bus smras pa /
analyzed: sha radv'a ti'i bus smras pa /
translated: ” Śāradvatīputra said,

original: rigs kyi bu; gal te de bzhin gshegs pa mtshan nyid med pa yin na /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu; gal te de bzhin gshegs pa mtshan nyid med pa yin na /
translated: “Son of a good family, if the tathāgata is without characteristics,

original: de la ji ltar skyes bu chen po'i mtshan sum cu rtsa gnyis dang ldan zhing de bzhin gshegs pa zhes bstan cing dpe byad bzang po brgyad cus sku legs par brgyan /
analyzed: de la ji ltar skyes bu chen po'i mtshan sum cu rtsa gnyis dang ldan zhing de bzhin gshegs pa zhes bstan cing dpe byad bzang po brgyad cus sku legs par brgyan /
translated: how is it that he is said to be endowed with the thirty-two marks of a great being and is called a tathāgata, his body well adorned with the eighty minor marks,

original: ji ltar de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku gsum rnam par gzhag par lta /
analyzed: ji ltar de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku gsum rnam par gzhag par lta /
translated: and how is it that the three bodies of the Tathāgata are posited?”

original: ji ltar de bzhin gshegs pa bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas /
analyzed: ji ltar de bzhin gshegs pa bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas /
translated: How did the Tathāgata fully awaken to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening?

original: gsang ba pa'i bdag po lag na rdo rjes smras pa /
analyzed: gsang ba pa'i bdag po lag na rdo rjes smras pa /
translated: Vajrapāṇi, Lord of the Secret Ones, said,

original: btsun pa sha ra dv'a ti'i bu /
analyzed: btsun pa sha ra dv'a ti'i bu /
translated: “Venerable Śāradvatīputra,

original: skyes bu chen po'i mtshan sum cu rtsa gnyis zhes bya ba de ni /
analyzed: skyes bu chen po'i mtshan sum cu rtsa gnyis zhes bya ba de ni /
translated: the so-called thirty-two marks of a great person

original: kun rdzob kyi brda'i tshig go /
analyzed: kun rdzob kyi brda'i tshig go /
translated: are conventional symbolic words.

original: brgyan ces bya ba ni /
analyzed: brgyan ces bya ba ni /
translated: ‘Ornament’

original: spros pa'i yi ge dang / sgra'o //
analyzed: spros pa'i yi ge dang / sgra'o //
translated: refers to elaborations of letters and sounds.

original: dpe byad bzang po zhes bya ba de ni /
analyzed: dpe byad bzang po zhes bya ba de ni /
translated: The so-called excellent signs

original: sgyu @324b ma dang / rmi lam gyi ngo bo nyid mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: sgyu @324b ma dang / rmi lam gyi ngo bo nyid mtshan nyid do //
translated: are characterized as being like illusions and dreams.

original: yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub ces bya ba de ni /
analyzed: yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub ces bya ba de ni /
translated: The so-called unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening

original: nam mkha'i ngo bo nyid kyi mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: nam mkha'i ngo bo nyid kyi mtshan nyid do //
translated: is characterized as having the nature of space.

original: sku gsum rnam par gzhag pa zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: sku gsum rnam par gzhag pa zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The so-called arrangement of the three bodies

original: tshogs gnyis kyis sprul pa'i mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: tshogs gnyis kyis sprul pa'i mtshan nyid do //
translated: is characterized as being emanated by the two accumulations.

original: btsun pa sh'a radv'a ti'i bu /
analyzed: btsun pa sh'a radv'a ti'i bu /
translated: Venerable Śāradvatīputra,

original: yang 'di ni /
analyzed: yang 'di ni /
translated: this is

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku'i gsang ba'i yul te /🔽de la sku gsang ba zhes bya ba de ni /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku'i gsang ba'i yul te / de la sku gsang ba zhes bya ba de ni /
translated: It is the secret domain of the Tathāgata’s body.🔽“

original: bsod nams chen po'i rgyu mthun pa'i mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: bsod nams chen po'i rgyu mthun pa'i mtshan nyid do //
translated: The secret body is the characteristic of the cause of great merit.

original: bsod nams kyi rgyu mthun pa gang yin pa de de bzhin gshegs pa'i rdzogs par longs spyod pa'i sku ste /
analyzed: bsod nams kyi rgyu mthun pa gang yin pa de de bzhin gshegs pa'i rdzogs par longs spyod pa'i sku ste /
translated: The cause of merit is the Tathāgata’s body of perfect enjoyment.

original: 'di yang de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku'i 'phrin las dang / sku'i gsang ba pa'o //
analyzed: 'di yang de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku'i 'phrin las dang / sku'i gsang ba pa'o //
translated: This is the Tathāgata’s activity of body and the secret of body.🔽“

original: btsun pa sh'a radv'a ti'i bu /🔽gsung zhes bya ba de ni /
analyzed: btsun pa sh'a radv'a ti'i bu / gsung zhes bya ba de ni /
translated: Reverend Śāradvatīputra,

original: kun rdzob dang / don dam pa gnyis kyi mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: kun rdzob dang / don dam pa gnyis kyi mtshan nyid do //
translated: speech is the characteristic of the relative and the ultimate.

original: kun rdzob dang / don dam pa gnyis kyi mtshan nyid gang yin pa de de bzhin gshegs pa'i sprul pa'i sku'o //
analyzed: kun rdzob dang / don dam pa gnyis kyi mtshan nyid gang yin pa de de bzhin gshegs pa'i sprul pa'i sku'o //
translated: The relative and the ultimate are the Tathāgata’s emanation body.

original: rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba chad pa med pa dang / rtag pa med par 'jug pa thugs su chud pa /
analyzed: rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba chad pa med pa dang / rtag pa med par 'jug pa thugs su chud pa /
translated: It is the realization of dependent origination as neither annihilated nor eternal.

original: yid kyi rnam par shes pa'i lam gyis 'jug pa /
analyzed: yid kyi rnam par shes pa'i lam gyis 'jug pa /
translated: It is the path of mental consciousness.

original: bsam gtan goms par byas pas shes bar bya ba ste /
analyzed: bsam gtan goms par byas pas shes bar bya ba ste /
translated: It is to be known through the cultivation of meditation.

original: dmigs pa med pa kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / rnam par byang bas stong pa /
analyzed: dmigs pa med pa kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / rnam par byang bas stong pa /
translated: It is free from the afflictions of conceptualization and is empty of purification and affliction.

original: lus kyi yul ma yin pa /
analyzed: lus kyi yul ma yin pa /
translated: It is not an object of the body.

original: ngag gi spyod yul ma yin /
analyzed: ngag gi spyod yul ma yin /
translated: It is not an object of speech.

original: yid kyi rang gi ngo @325a *//🔽bo'i yul ma yin pa gang yin pa de ni /
analyzed: yid kyi rang gi ngo @325a *// bo'i yul ma yin pa gang yin pa de ni /
translated: It is not an object of the mind.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i chos kyi sku nam mkha'i khams su yang dag par 'du ba'o //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i chos kyi sku nam mkha'i khams su yang dag par 'du ba'o //
translated: It is the dharmakāya of the tathāgatas, which is gathered into the realm of space.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku gsum rnam par gzhag pa de ltar blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku gsum rnam par gzhag pa de ltar blta bar bya'o //
translated: The three bodies of the tathāgatas should be seen in this way.

original: btsun pa sh'a radv'a ti'i bu /
analyzed: btsun pa sh'a radv'a ti'i bu /
translated: “Venerable Śāradvatīputra,

original: gzhan yang de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku'i gsang ba gang yin pa de ni /
analyzed: gzhan yang de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku'i gsang ba gang yin pa de ni /
translated: the secret of the body of the tathāgatas

original: chos kyi sku'o //
analyzed: chos kyi sku'o //
translated: is the dharmakāya.

original: chos kyi sku gang yin pa de ni /
analyzed: chos kyi sku gang yin pa de ni /
translated: The dharmakāya

original: chos rnams kyi dbu ma'i lam du blta'o //
analyzed: chos rnams kyi dbu ma'i lam du blta'o //
translated: is to be seen as the middle way of phenomena.

original: dbu ma'i lam gang yin pa de ni /
analyzed: dbu ma'i lam gang yin pa de ni /
translated: The middle way

original: mi skye mi 'chi ba ste /
analyzed: mi skye mi 'chi ba ste /
translated: is neither born nor does it die.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa rnams byung yang rung /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa rnams byung yang rung /
translated: Whether the tathāgatas appear

original: ma byung yang rung /
analyzed: ma byung yang rung /
translated: or do not appear,

original: chos kyi sku 'di ni /
analyzed: chos kyi sku 'di ni /
translated: This dharmakāya,

original: gnas pa nyid do //
analyzed: gnas pa nyid do //
translated: is just the abiding.

original: btsun pa sh'a radva ti'i bu /
analyzed: btsun pa sh'a radva ti'i bu /
translated: Venerable Śāradvatīputra,

original: bsod nams kyi rgyu mthun pa zhes bya ba de ni /
analyzed: bsod nams kyi rgyu mthun pa zhes bya ba de ni /
translated: what is called the ‘concordant cause of merit’

original: pha rol tu phyin pa dag gi rnam grangs su gtogs pa'o //
analyzed: pha rol tu phyin pa dag gi rnam grangs su gtogs pa'o //
translated: is included in the synonyms of the perfections.

original: de la pha rol tu phyin pa zhes bya ba de yang bsod nams kyi rgyu mthun pa nyid du blta'o //
analyzed: de la pha rol tu phyin pa zhes bya ba de yang bsod nams kyi rgyu mthun pa nyid du blta'o //
translated: There, what is called the ‘perfection’ should be seen as just the concordant cause of merit.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: btsun pa sh'a radva ti'i bu /
analyzed: btsun pa sh'a radva ti'i bu /
translated: Venerable Śāradvatīputra,

original: sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa zhes bya ba de ni /
analyzed: sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa zhes bya ba de ni /
translated: what is called the ‘perfection of generosity’

original: phyi nang gi dngos po rnam pa gnyis yongs su gtang bar bya ba'o //
analyzed: phyi nang gi dngos po rnam pa gnyis yongs su gtang bar bya ba'o //
translated: is the giving up of both the outer and inner things.

original: de la phyi zhes bya ba de ni /
analyzed: de la phyi zhes bya ba de ni /
translated: There, what is called ‘outer’

original: kun rdzob kyi tshig go /
analyzed: kun rdzob kyi tshig go /
translated: is a conventional term.

original: nang zhes bya ba de ni /
analyzed: nang zhes bya ba de ni /
translated: What is called ‘inner’

original: don dam pa'i tshig go /
analyzed: don dam pa'i tshig go /
translated: is an ultimate term.

original: de la phyi zhes bya ba de ni /
analyzed: de la phyi zhes bya ba de ni /
translated: There, what is called ‘outer’

original: gang zas 'dod pa rnams la zas dang / skom 'dod pa rnams dang / de bzhin bran pho dang / @325b bran mo dang / las byed pa dang / zho shas 'tsho ba dang / glang po che dang / rta dang / shing rta dang /
analyzed: gang zas 'dod pa rnams la zas dang / skom 'dod pa rnams dang / de bzhin bran pho dang / @325b bran mo dang / las byed pa dang / zho shas 'tsho ba dang / glang po che dang / rta dang / shing rta dang /
translated: To those who desire food, he gives food; to those who desire drink, he gives drink; likewise, he gives male and female servants, workers, laborers, elephants, horses, chariots,

original: sa dang / mgo dang / lag pa dang / rkang pa dang / mig dang / sha dang / khrag dang / rkang dang / tshil dang / rus pa'i bar du sbyin pa ste /
analyzed: sa dang / mgo dang / lag pa dang / rkang pa dang / mig dang / sha dang / khrag dang / rkang dang / tshil dang / rus pa'i bar du sbyin pa ste /
translated: earth, head, hands, feet, eyes, flesh, blood, marrow, and even bone marrow.

original: de yang thabs kyi pha rol tu phyin pas yongs su zin pas yongs su bsngos pa rnam par smin pa la mi re ba dang / gya nom pa dang / rgyan pa dang / rang gi bsti stang du byas te rnam pa thams cad sems can thams cad la sbyin pa 'di ni /
analyzed: de yang thabs kyi pha rol tu phyin pas yongs su zin pas yongs su bsngos pa rnam par smin pa la mi re ba dang / gya nom pa dang / rgyan pa dang / rang gi bsti stang du byas te rnam pa thams cad sems can thams cad la sbyin pa 'di ni /
translated: Moreover, by being embraced by the perfection of skillful means, he dedicates [his gifts] without hope of ripening, with excellence, with adornment, and with his own respect. This giving to all sentient beings in all ways is the giving of external things.

original: phyi'i 'o // nang gi chos sbyin pa'o //
analyzed: phyi'i 'o // nang gi chos sbyin pa'o //
translated: The giving of internal things is as follows.

original: de yang rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: de yang rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: It is also of two kinds.

original: rten cir 'brel bar 'byung ba la 'jug par yang dag par gzhol ba dang / sbyin pa'i gtam dang / tshul khrims kyi gtam dang / bzod pa'i gtam dang / brtson 'grus dang / bsam gtan dang / shes rab dang / thabs dang / stobs dang /
analyzed: rten cir 'brel bar 'byung ba la 'jug par yang dag par gzhol ba dang / sbyin pa'i gtam dang / tshul khrims kyi gtam dang / bzod pa'i gtam dang / brtson 'grus dang / bsam gtan dang / shes rab dang / thabs dang / stobs dang /
translated: and the perfection of aspiration and wisdom.🔽“Moreover, inner generosity🔽is to be dedicated to the perfection of power, which is to be embraced by delight in the abandonment of the realization of extremes, arising, and cessation, of concepts, of knowledge, and of the knowable.🔽This is the generosity of the Dharma.

original: smon lam dang / ye shes kyi gtam dang / snying rjes yongs su zin pa thabs kyi pha rol tu phyin par yang dag par 'du ba'o //
analyzed: smon lam dang / ye shes kyi gtam dang / snying rjes yongs su zin pa thabs kyi pha rol tu phyin par yang dag par 'du ba'o //
translated: It is to be dedicated to the perfection of power, which is to be embraced by delight in the abandonment of the realization of extremes, arising, and cessation, of concepts, of knowledge, and of the knowable.

original: gzhan yang nang gi sbyin pa ni /
analyzed: gzhan yang nang gi sbyin pa ni /
translated: This is the generosity of the Dharma.🔽It is to be dedicated to the perfection of power, which is to be embraced by delight in the abandonment of the realization of extremes, arising, and cessation, of concepts, of knowledge, and of the knowable.🔽This is the generosity of the Dharma.🔽It is to be dedicated to the perfection of power, which is to be embraced by delight in the abandonment of the realization of extremes, arising, and cessation, of concepts, of knowledge, and of the knowable.🔽This is the generosity of the Dharma.

original: gang 'di mthar 'dzin pa dang / skye ba dang / 'gag par yongs su rtogs pa dang / rnam par rtog pa dang / shes pa dang / shes bya rnam par spong bar dga' bas yongs su zin pa'i stobs kyi pha rol tu phyin par yang dag par 'du ba ste /
analyzed: gang 'di mthar 'dzin pa dang / skye ba dang / 'gag par yongs su rtogs pa dang / rnam par rtog pa dang / shes pa dang / shes bya rnam par spong bar dga' bas yongs su zin pa'i stobs kyi pha rol tu phyin par yang dag par 'du ba ste /
translated: It is to be dedicated to the perfection of power, which is to be embraced by delight in the abandonment of the realization of extremes, arising, and cessation, of concepts, of knowledge, and of the knowable.🔽This is the generosity of the Dharma.🔽It is to be dedicated to the perfection of power, which is to be embraced by delight in the abandonment of the realization of extremes, arising, and cessation, of concepts, of knowledge, and of the knowable.🔽This is the generosity of the Dharma.🔽It is to be dedicated to the perfection of power, which is to be embraced by delight in the abandonment of the realization of extremes, arising, and cessation, of concepts, of knowledge, and of the knowable.🔽This is the generosity of the Dharma.🔽It is to be dedicated to the perfection of power, which is to be embraced by delight in the abandonment of the realization of extremes, arising, and cessation, of concepts, of knowledge, and of the knowable.🔽This is the generosity of the Dharma.

original: 'di ni / chos kyi sbyin pa'o //🔽gang 'di nyid la @326a *//
analyzed: 'di ni / chos kyi sbyin pa'o //🔽gang 'di nyid la @326a *//
translated: It is to be dedicated to the

original: lus dang / ngag dang / yid rgod pa med pa dang / khengs pa med pa dang / lus rnam par g-yeng ba med pa dang / ngag rnam par g-yeng ba med pa dang / yid rnam par g-yeng ba med par shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pas yongs su zin pa /
analyzed: lus dang / ngag dang / yid rgod pa med pa dang / khengs pa med pa dang / lus rnam par g-yeng ba med pa dang / ngag rnam par g-yeng ba med pa dang / yid rnam par g-yeng ba med par shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pas yongs su zin pa /
translated: It is the perfection of wisdom that is not distracted in body, speech, or mind, that is not arrogant, that is not distracted in body, that is not distracted in speech, and that is not distracted in mind.

original: gcig tu nyon mongs pa med par gnas /🔽btang snyoms kyis yongs su zin pa; thabs kyi pha rol tu phyin par yang dag par 'du ba 'di ni /
analyzed: gcig tu nyon mongs pa med par gnas / btang snyoms kyis yongs su zin pa; thabs kyi pha rol tu phyin par yang dag par 'du ba 'di ni /
translated: It is the single abode of the absence of afflictions.🔽It is the perfection of wisdom that is embraced by equanimity and is included in the perfection of means.

original: tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'o //
analyzed: tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'o //
translated: This is the perfection of morality.

original: gang 'di nyid la rang gi lus dang srog la mi lta bar bsod nams dang / bsod nams ma yin pa dang / chos dang / chos ma yin pa dang / bden pa dang / bden pa ma yin pa dang / g-yo ba dang / mi g-yo ba'i dngos po rnam par spong zhing byams pas yongs su zin pa shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin par yang dag par 'du ba 'di ni /🔽'dir bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa'o //🔽gang sbyin pa dang / tshul khrims dang / bzod pa dang / ting nge 'dzin thob par bya ba'i phyir sems spro zhing rtsom pa dang / yongs su mi skyo bar rtag tu gnas pa med pa dang / de dmigs pa med pa dang / byams pas yongs su zin pa ye shes kyi pha rol tu phyin par yang dag par 'du ba 'di ni /
analyzed: gang 'di nyid la rang gi lus dang srog la mi lta bar bsod nams dang / bsod nams ma yin pa dang / chos dang / chos ma yin pa dang / bden pa dang / bden pa ma yin pa dang / g-yo ba dang / mi g-yo ba'i dngos po rnam par spong zhing byams pas yongs su zin pa shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin par yang dag par 'du ba 'di ni / 'dir bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa'o // gang sbyin pa dang / tshul khrims dang / bzod pa dang / ting nge 'dzin thob par bya ba'i phyir sems spro zhing rtsom pa dang / yongs su mi skyo bar rtag tu gnas pa med pa dang / de dmigs pa med pa dang / byams pas yongs su zin pa ye shes kyi pha rol tu phyin par yang dag par 'du ba 'di ni /
translated: It is the perfection of patience here that, without regard for one’s own body and life, one abandons things that are meritorious and not meritorious, spiritual and not spiritual, true and not true, and moving and unmoving, and is embraced by loving kindness and is included in the perfection of wisdom.🔽It is the perfection of effort here that, in order to attain generosity, morality, patience, and concentration, one is enthusiastic and persevering, and one remains constantly without discouragement, and one is without reference points and is embraced by loving kindness and is included in the perfection of wisdom.

original: 'dir brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'o //
analyzed: 'dir brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'o //
translated: It is the perfection of meditation here that, in order to attain generosity, morality, patience, and effort, one is enthusiastic and persevering, and one remains constantly without discouragement, and one is without reference points and is embraced by loving kindness and is included in the perfection of wisdom.

original: btsun pa @326b sh'a r'dva ti'i bu /
analyzed: btsun pa @326b sh'a r'dva ti'i bu /
translated: Venerable Śāradvatīputra,

original: 'di ni / bsod nams kyi tshogs te /
analyzed: 'di ni / bsod nams kyi tshogs te /
translated: this is the accumulation of merit,

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i rdzogs par longs spyod pa'i sku'i gsang ba grub par byed pa'o //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i rdzogs par longs spyod pa'i sku'i gsang ba grub par byed pa'o //
translated: which accomplishes the secret of the Tathāgata’s perfect enjoyment body.

original: btsun pa sh'a rdva ti'i bu /
analyzed: btsun pa sh'a rdva ti'i bu /
translated: Venerable Śāradvatīputra,

original: gzhan yang ye shes kyi tshogs ni /
analyzed: gzhan yang ye shes kyi tshogs ni /
translated: furthermore, the accumulation of wisdom

original: gang pha rol tu phyin pa bzhi po 'di dag nyid rdzogs pa ste /
analyzed: gang pha rol tu phyin pa bzhi po 'di dag nyid rdzogs pa ste /
translated: is the completion of these very four perfections.🔽It is the analysis, explanation, and clarification of the perfections,

original: pha rol tu phyin pa rnams 'byed pa dang / 'grel ba dang / gsal bar byed pa dang / de la gzhol zhing mi rtag pa dang / bdag med pa dang / stong pa dang / gsob dang / gsog dang / dngos po med pa dang /
analyzed: pha rol tu phyin pa rnams 'byed pa dang / 'grel ba dang / gsal bar byed pa dang / de la gzhol zhing mi rtag pa dang / bdag med pa dang / stong pa dang / gsob dang / gsog dang / dngos po med pa dang /
translated: and it is the inclination towards them, and the correct teaching of impermanence, selflessness, emptiness, hollowness, futility, non-entity,

original: dngos po thams cad dngos med par yang dag par ston to //
analyzed: dngos po thams cad dngos med par yang dag par ston to //
translated: and the non-entity of all entities.

original: mdor bsdu ba na 'dod chags dang / zhe sdang dang / gti mug dang / nyon mongs pa dang / nye ba'i nyon mongs pa sel cing chos kyi dbyings nam mkha' mtha' yas skye mched dang mnyam par yang dag par ston to //
analyzed: mdor bsdu ba na 'dod chags dang / zhe sdang dang / gti mug dang / nyon mongs pa dang / nye ba'i nyon mongs pa sel cing chos kyi dbyings nam mkha' mtha' yas skye mched dang mnyam par yang dag par ston to //
translated: In brief, it eliminates desire, hatred, delusion, afflictions, and secondary afflictions, and it reveals the space-like sphere of reality.🔽

original: dmigs pa dang bral ba 'di ni /
analyzed: dmigs pa dang bral ba 'di ni /
translated: In brief, it is the elimination of desire, hatred, delusion, afflictions, and secondary afflictions, and it is the teaching of the sameness of the space-like infinite realm of phenomena.

original: 'dir bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa'o //
analyzed: 'dir bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa'o //
translated: This is the perfection of concentration here.

original: de bzhin nyid dang / stong pa nyid dang / mtha' las 'das pa stong pa nyid dang / phyi ma'i mtha' stong pa nyid dang / chos kyi dbyings kyi rang gi ngo bo nyid gang yin pa 'di ni /
analyzed: de bzhin nyid dang / stong pa nyid dang / mtha' las 'das pa stong pa nyid dang / phyi ma'i mtha' stong pa nyid dang / chos kyi dbyings kyi rang gi ngo bo nyid gang yin pa 'di ni /
translated: The suchness, emptiness, transcendence of extremes, emptiness of the other side, and the very essence of the realm of phenomena—

original: 'dir shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'o //
analyzed: 'dir shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'o //
translated: this is the perfection of wisdom here.

original: btsun pa sha rdv'a ti'i bu /
analyzed: btsun pa sha rdv'a ti'i bu /
translated: Venerable Śāradvatīputra,

original: 'di ni / ye shes kyi tshogs so //🔽bsod nams kyi tshogs dang / ye shes kyi tshogs dang / tshogs 'di gnyis ni /
analyzed: 'di ni / ye shes kyi tshogs so // bsod nams kyi tshogs dang / ye shes kyi tshogs dang / tshogs 'di gnyis ni /
translated: this is the accumulation of wisdom.🔽The accumulation of merit and the accumulation of wisdom—

original: byang chub kyi phyogs @327a *//
analyzed: byang chub kyi phyogs @327a *//
translated: these two accumulations

original: kyi chos dang / shes pa dang / shes bya mtha' dag dang / bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub yang dag par rtogs par byed pa ste /
analyzed: kyi chos dang / shes pa dang / shes bya mtha' dag dang / bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub yang dag par rtogs par byed pa ste /
translated: the Dharma, consciousness, and all that is knowable, and unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening.

original: btsun pa sh'a rdva ti'i bu /
analyzed: btsun pa sh'a rdva ti'i bu /
translated: Venerable Śāradvatīputra,

original: 'di ni / de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku'i gsang ba dag gis mdor bsdus te bstan pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni / de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku'i gsang ba dag gis mdor bsdus te bstan pa'o //
translated: this is the concise teaching of the secret of the Tathāgata’s body.

original: rgya cher rnam par dbye ba ni /
analyzed: rgya cher rnam par dbye ba ni /
translated: The extensive classification

original: gsal te de bzhin gshegs pa nyid kyis sku tshe'i tshad bskal par bzhugs te bstan cing bshad kyang mthar phyin par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gsal te de bzhin gshegs pa nyid kyis sku tshe'i tshad bskal par bzhugs te bstan cing bshad kyang mthar phyin par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: is clear. Even if the Tathāgata himself were to teach and explain for an eon, it would not be completed.

original: sku'i gsang ba ji lta ba bzhin du gsung gi gsang ba yang de bzhin no //
analyzed: sku'i gsang ba ji lta ba bzhin du gsung gi gsang ba yang de bzhin no //
translated: Just as with the secret of the body, so it is with the secret of speech.

original: thugs kyi gsang ba ni /
analyzed: thugs kyi gsang ba ni /
translated: The secret of mind🔽is as follows:

original: de bzhin gshegs pas rnam pa dang / so so'i rnam pa dang / kha dog dang / rtags dang / dbyibs dang / ngag gi rnam par rtog pa'i spyod yul dang / bya ba tha dad pa'i sbyor ba rnams kyis kyang bstan par mi spyod mod kyi /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pas rnam pa dang / so so'i rnam pa dang / kha dog dang / rtags dang / dbyibs dang / ngag gi rnam par rtog pa'i spyod yul dang / bya ba tha dad pa'i sbyor ba rnams kyis kyang bstan par mi spyod mod kyi /
translated: The Tathāgata does not teach by means of the categories, the individual categories, the colors, the signs, the shapes, the objects of conceptual thought, or the different applications of speech.

original: 'on kyang de bzhin gshegs pa'i so so rang gis rig pa'i thugs kyi gsang ba yin par shes par bya'o //
analyzed: 'on kyang de bzhin gshegs pa'i so so rang gis rig pa'i thugs kyi gsang ba yin par shes par bya'o //
translated: However, it should be understood that it is the secret of the Tathāgata’s own wisdom.

original: btsun pa sh'a rdva ti'i bu /
analyzed: btsun pa sh'a rdva ti'i bu /
translated: “Venerable Śāradvatīputra,

original: de ni / de'i phyir rnam grangs 'dis de ltar rig par bya ste /
analyzed: de ni / de'i phyir rnam grangs 'dis de ltar rig par bya ste /
translated: for that reason, you should understand it in this way:

original: bdag cag lta bu byang chub mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas pa rnams kyis bstan pa lta smos kyang ci dgos /
analyzed: bdag cag lta bu byang chub mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas pa rnams kyis bstan pa lta smos kyang ci dgos /
translated: what need is there to speak of those like us who have fully awakened to perfect buddhahood?

original: 'on kyang de bzhin gshegs pa'i byin gyi rlabs kyis sems can gyi khams mtha' yas mu med @327b pa'i bsam pa dang / lhag pa'i bsam pa dang / mos pa dang / blo gros dang / blo dang / rtogs pa dang / mngon par 'dod pa mtha' yas mu med pa dang /
analyzed: 'on kyang de bzhin gshegs pa'i byin gyi rlabs kyis sems can gyi khams mtha' yas mu med @327b pa'i bsam pa dang / lhag pa'i bsam pa dang / mos pa dang / blo gros dang / blo dang / rtogs pa dang / mngon par 'dod pa mtha' yas mu med pa dang /
translated: However, through the blessings of the Tathāgata, the aspirations, higher intentions, interests, understandings, thoughts, realizations, and desires of the infinite and limitless realms of sentient beings,

original: sems kyi rgyun rnam pa tha dad pa sna tshogs kyi rjes su 'gro ba'i spyod yul dang / skye gnas sna tshogs dang / lhan cig skyes pa'i las sna tshogs dang / mi shes pa dang / ma rig pa'i mun pa dang / mi snang ba dang /
analyzed: sems kyi rgyun rnam pa tha dad pa sna tshogs kyi rjes su 'gro ba'i spyod yul dang / skye gnas sna tshogs dang / lhan cig skyes pa'i las sna tshogs dang / mi shes pa dang / ma rig pa'i mun pa dang / mi snang ba dang /
translated: which are the objects of the various different continuums of mind, the various birthplaces, the various co-emergent karmas, the ignorance, the darkness of ignorance, the non-appearance,

original: mun nag dang / 'gro ba lnga dang / 'gro ba drug dang / khams gsum pa thog ma dang / dbus dang / 'jig par gnas pa /
analyzed: mun nag dang / 'gro ba lnga dang / 'gro ba drug dang / khams gsum pa thog ma dang / dbus dang / 'jig par gnas pa /
translated: the darkness, the five destinies, the six destinies, and the beginning, middle, and end of the three realms,

original: sngon gyi mtha' dang / phyi ma'i mtha' yongs su ma chad par gnas par dus gsum dang / phyogs la mgo rmongs pa /
analyzed: sngon gyi mtha' dang / phyi ma'i mtha' yongs su ma chad par gnas par dus gsum dang / phyogs la mgo rmongs pa /
translated: which remain without a prior limit or a later limit, are confused about the three times and the directions,

original: skye ba dang / rga ba la sogs pa na ba dang / nad dang / mya ngan pa dang / smre sngags 'don pa dang / sdug bsngal ba dang / yid mi bde ba dang / 'khrug pa la sogs pas nyin gcig bzhin du bcom pa'i sems can rnams kyi sems can gyi khams ma rgal ba bsgral ba dang /
analyzed: skye ba dang / rga ba la sogs pa na ba dang / nad dang / mya ngan pa dang / smre sngags 'don pa dang / sdug bsngal ba dang / yid mi bde ba dang / 'khrug pa la sogs pas nyin gcig bzhin du bcom pa'i sems can rnams kyi sems can gyi khams ma rgal ba bsgral ba dang /
translated: The Bhagavān said, Anantavyūha, you have asked this well.🔽Anantavyūha, you should listen carefully and keep this in mind.🔽I will now explain the dhāraṇī gateway that is the gateway to the dhāraṇī of the bodhisattvas.🔽Anantavyūha, the dhāraṇī gateway is called the gateway of the dhāraṇī of the bodhisattvas.🔽 Anantavyūha, the dhāraṇī gateway is called the gateway of the dhāraṇī of the bodhisattvas.🔽 Anantavyūha, the dhāraṇī gateway is called the gateway of the dhāraṇī of the bodhisattvas.

original: ma grol ba dgrol ba dang / dbugs ma phyin pa dbugs dbyung ba dang / yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa yongs su mya ngan las bzla ba dang / chos kyi rnam grangs 'di la gzud pa dang / gnas pa thams cad gyur ba'i lam la dgod pa dang /
analyzed: ma grol ba dgrol ba dang / dbugs ma phyin pa dbugs dbyung ba dang / yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa yongs su mya ngan las bzla ba dang / chos kyi rnam grangs 'di la gzud pa dang / gnas pa thams cad gyur ba'i lam la dgod pa dang /
translated: Anantavyūha, the dhāraṇī gateway is called the gateway of the dhāraṇī of the bodhisattvas.

original: mya ngan las 'das pa shin tu de ba /🔽don dam pa /🔽zhi ba / 'khrugs pa med pa /
analyzed: mya ngan las 'das pa shin tu de ba / don dam pa / zhi ba / 'khrugs pa med pa /
translated: Anantavyūha, the dhāraṇī gateway is called the gateway of the dhāraṇī of the bodhisattvas.🔽 Anantavyūha, the dhāraṇī gateway is called the gateway of the dhāraṇī of the bodhisattvas.🔽 Anantavyūha, the dhāraṇī gateway is called the gateway of the dhāraṇī of the bodhisattvas.🔽 Anantavyūha, the dhāraṇī gateway is called the gateway of the dhāraṇī of the bodhisattvas.🔽 Anantavyūha, the dhāraṇī gateway is called the gateway of the dhāraṇī of the bodhisattvas.

original: dge ba / nad med pa @328a *//
analyzed: dge ba / nad med pa @328a *//
translated: Anantavyūha, the dhāraṇī gateway is called the gateway of the dhāraṇī of the bodhisattvas.🔽 Anantavyūha, the dhāraṇī gateway is called the gateway of the dhāraṇī of the bodhisattvas.🔽 Anantavyūha, the dhāraṇī gateway is called the gateway of the dhāraṇī of the bodhisattvas.🔽 Anantavyūha, the dhāraṇī gateway is called the gateway of the dhāraṇī of the bodhisattvas.🔽 Anantavyūha, the dhāraṇī gateway is called the gateway of the dhāraṇī of the bodhisattvas.

original: dang / sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi so so rang gi rig pa'i ye shes kyi dbyings mnyam pa nyid kyis mi mnyam pa dang mnyam pa /
analyzed: dang / sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi so so rang gi rig pa'i ye shes kyi dbyings mnyam pa nyid kyis mi mnyam pa dang mnyam pa /
translated: and the space of the individually intuited gnosis of the bhagavat buddhas is the same, so that they are equal in their inequality.

original: rnam pa thams cad kyi mchog dang ldan pa'i thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes la sbyor ba dang / yang dag par 'dzin du 'jug pa dang / yang dag par gzengs bstod pa dang / yang dag par rab tu dga' bar bya ba dang / dga' ba dang /
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad kyi mchog dang ldan pa'i thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes la sbyor ba dang / yang dag par 'dzin du 'jug pa dang / yang dag par gzengs bstod pa dang / yang dag par rab tu dga' bar bya ba dang / dga' ba dang /
translated: They are connected to the gnosis of omniscience, which is endowed with the most sublime of all aspects, and they are caused to take it up, to be inspired by it, to be delighted by it, to be pleased by it,

original: dang ba dang / mgu ba'i sa la yang dag par gzud pa dang / chos rtogs pa'i khyad par brjod pa dang / rgya mtsho chen po ltar 'dul ba'i sems can yongs su smin par bya ba'i dus dang / tshod las mi 'da' bar bya ba dang /
analyzed: dang ba dang / mgu ba'i sa la yang dag par gzud pa dang / chos rtogs pa'i khyad par brjod pa dang / rgya mtsho chen po ltar 'dul ba'i sems can yongs su smin par bya ba'i dus dang / tshod las mi 'da' bar bya ba dang /
translated: to be introduced to the level of joy, to be introduced to the level of faith, to be introduced to the level of satisfaction, to express the distinctive realization of the Dharma, and to not pass beyond the time and occasion for ripening the beings to be trained, just as they would not pass beyond the great ocean.

original: de dag la rgyu de'i dbang du byas te skye bo'i tshogs chen po'i don dang phan pa dang / bde ba dang / lha dang / mi rnams kyi don dang / theg pa chen po bla na med pa'i chos kyi tshul gcig nas gcig tu brgyud de gnas par bya ba dang /
analyzed: de dag la rgyu de'i dbang du byas te skye bo'i tshogs chen po'i don dang phan pa dang / bde ba dang / lha dang / mi rnams kyi don dang / theg pa chen po bla na med pa'i chos kyi tshul gcig nas gcig tu brgyud de gnas par bya ba dang /
translated: For the sake of that cause, I will explain a little bit, having made one door of a mere fraction of the subject matter manifest in front of me, for the sake of the benefit, welfare, and happiness of a great assembly of beings, for the sake of the benefit of gods and humans, for the sake of the lineage of the Dharma of the unsurpassed Mahāyāna being passed from one to another,

original: gcig nas gcig tu lung byin pas thos pa dang / bsam pa dang / bsgoms pa las byung ba'i shes rab dang / ye shes goms pa rnal 'byor du gyur pa'i rgyud kyi rgyun mi bcad pa dang / skal pa yod la yongs su ma smin pa yongs su smin par bya ba'i 'os su gyur pa'i don gyi phyir phyogs tsam gyi sgo gcig mdun du byas te @328b 'jug par byed pa cung zad cig bshad par bya'o //
analyzed: gcig nas gcig tu lung byin pas thos pa dang / bsam pa dang / bsgoms pa las byung ba'i shes rab dang / ye shes goms pa rnal 'byor du gyur pa'i rgyud kyi rgyun mi bcad pa dang / skal pa yod la yongs su ma smin pa yongs su smin par bya ba'i 'os su gyur pa'i don gyi phyir phyogs tsam gyi sgo gcig mdun du byas te @328b 'jug par byed pa cung zad cig bshad par bya'o //
translated: for the sake of the lineage of the continuity of the yoga of the familiarization with the wisdom and the pristine awareness that arise from hearing, reflection, and meditation, and for the sake of the ripened being who is suitable to be ripened, who has the fortune, but is not yet ripened.

original: de skad ces smras pa dang / tshe dang ldan pa sh'a rdva ti'i bu /
analyzed: de skad ces smras pa dang / tshe dang ldan pa sh'a rdva ti'i bu /
translated: When this was said, the venerable Śāradvatīputra

original: mchog tu ngo mtshar du gyur cing rmad du byung bar gyur te dga' ba thob nas gsang ba pa'i bdag po lag na rdo rje la 'di skad ces smros so //
analyzed: mchog tu ngo mtshar du gyur cing rmad du byung bar gyur te dga' ba thob nas gsang ba pa'i bdag po lag na rdo rje la 'di skad ces smros so //
translated: He was supremely astonished and amazed, and having attained joy, he said this to Guhyapati Vajrapāṇi:

original: rigs kyi bu /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu /
translated: “Son of noble family,

original: legs so legs so /
analyzed: legs so legs so /
translated: excellent, excellent!

original: gang gi phyir kho bo cag lta bu'i nyi tshe ba'i shes pa dang ldan pa gzhan gyis sgra bsgrags pa'i rjes su 'gro ba'i nyan thos rnams la chos zab mo'i tshig gi don 'di lta bu gsal bar byas pa ni /
analyzed: gang gi phyir kho bo cag lta bu'i nyi tshe ba'i shes pa dang ldan pa gzhan gyis sgra bsgrags pa'i rjes su 'gro ba'i nyan thos rnams la chos zab mo'i tshig gi don 'di lta bu gsal bar byas pa ni /
translated: Because this profound Dharma statement of meaning has been clarified for the hearers who follow the proclamation of sound by others who possess limited knowledge like us,

original: rigs kyi bu /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu /
translated: son of noble family,

original: khyod yang legs so //
analyzed: khyod yang legs so //
translated: you are also excellent.

original: lag na rdo rjes smras pa /
analyzed: lag na rdo rjes smras pa /
translated: Vajrapāṇi said,

original: btsun pa sh'a rdva ti'i bu /
analyzed: btsun pa sh'a rdva ti'i bu /
translated: “Venerable Śāradvatīputra,

original: de de bzhin te /
analyzed: de de bzhin te /
translated: it is so, it is so.

original: ji skad smras pa de bzhin no //
analyzed: ji skad smras pa de bzhin no //
translated: It is just as you have said.

original: btsun pa sh'a rdva ti'i bu /🔽ting nge 'dzin 'di'i ming ci zhes de skad zer ba ni /
analyzed: btsun pa sh'a rdva ti'i bu / ting nge 'dzin 'di'i ming ci zhes de skad zer ba ni /
translated: Venerable Śāradvatīputra,

original: ting nge 'dzin 'di ming rdo rje'i rnam par thar pa'i sgo chen po zhes bya'o //
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin 'di ming rdo rje'i rnam par thar pa'i sgo chen po zhes bya'o //
translated: when you ask, ‘What is the name of this samādhi?’ this samādhi is called the great vajra liberation gate.

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis phyag g-yas pa gser gyi kha dog brkyang ste phyag g-yas pa 'jam zhing mnyen la shin tu gzhon sha chags pa gsang ba pa'i bdag po lag na rdo rje'i mgo la bzhag ste ched du bka' stsal pa 'di dag kyang ched du🔽bka' stsal to //
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis phyag g-yas pa gser gyi kha dog brkyang ste phyag g-yas pa 'jam zhing mnyen la shin tu gzhon sha chags pa gsang ba pa'i bdag po lag na rdo rje'i mgo la bzhag ste ched du bka' stsal pa 'di dag kyang ched du bka' stsal to //
translated: Then the Blessed One extended his right hand, which was golden in color, and placed it on the head of Guhyapati Vajrapāṇi, whose right hand was soft, supple, and very youthful, and spoke these words:

original: gsang ba pa'i bdag po lag na rdo rje /🔽khyod kyis gang mdo sde zab mo 'di lta bu 'di gsang ba pa'i tshig gi don bzhin du sems can thams cad la lung bstan cing bshad de dkrol @329a *//
analyzed: gsang ba pa'i bdag po lag na rdo rje / khyod kyis gang mdo sde zab mo 'di lta bu 'di gsang ba pa'i tshig gi don bzhin du sems can thams cad la lung bstan cing bshad de dkrol @329a *//
translated: Guhyapati Vajrapāṇi,

original: zhing rnam par phye ba legs so legs so //
analyzed: zhing rnam par phye ba legs so legs so //
translated: it is excellent, excellent, that you have explained to all beings the profound sūtras such as this, in accordance with the meaning of the secret words, and have revealed them, explained them, and analyzed them.

original: bcom ldan 'das de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas sh'akya thub pas lag na rdo rje la ji ltar legs so zhes bya ba byin pa de bzhin du phyogs bcu'i 'jig rten gyi khams su gtogs pa'i de bzhin gshegs pa thams
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas sh'akya thub pas lag na rdo rje la ji ltar legs so zhes bya ba byin pa de bzhin du phyogs bcu'i 'jig rten gyi khams su gtogs pa'i de bzhin gshegs pa thams
translated: Just as the bhagavat, the tathagata, the arhat, the perfectly enlightened buddha Shakyamuni gave the word “excellent” to Vajrapani, in the same way all the tathagatas in the worlds of the ten directions,

original: cad kyis kyang gsang ba pa'i bdag po lag na rdo rje'i mgo la phyag bzhag ste ched du bka' stsal pa 'di dag kyang ched du bka' stsal cing legs so zhes bya ba byin te /
analyzed: cad kyis kyang gsang ba pa'i bdag po lag na rdo rje'i mgo la phyag bzhag ste ched du bka' stsal pa 'di dag kyang ched du bka' stsal cing legs so zhes bya ba byin te /
translated: the lords of secrets, the vajra holders, placed their hands on the heads of the lords of secrets, Vajrapani, and spoke these words of praise and gave the word “excellent.”

original: rigs kyi bu /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu /
translated: “Son of family,

original: chos kyi rnam grangs 'jig rten gyi khams mang po dag na ming 'dzin pa yang dkon na /
analyzed: chos kyi rnam grangs 'jig rten gyi khams mang po dag na ming 'dzin pa yang dkon na /
translated: in many worlds it is rare to find someone who even holds the name of this dharma teaching,

original: rab tu gsal bar byed pa lta ci smos /
analyzed: rab tu gsal bar byed pa lta ci smos /
translated: let alone someone who illuminates it well.

original: gsang ba pa'i bdag po lag na rdo rjes chos kyi rnam grangs 'di bshad pa na lha'i bu gang+g'a'i klung tshad med grangs med dpag tu med pa'i bye ma'i rdul phra rab kyi rdul las shin tu 'das pa snyed chos rnams la chos kyi mig rdul med cing🔽dri ma dang bral ba skyes so //
analyzed: gsang ba pa'i bdag po lag na rdo rjes chos kyi rnam grangs 'di bshad pa na lha'i bu gang+g'a'i klung tshad med grangs med dpag tu med pa'i bye ma'i rdul phra rab kyi rdul las shin tu 'das pa snyed chos rnams la chos kyi mig rdul med cing dri ma dang bral ba skyes so //
translated: When the Lord of Secrets, Vajrapāṇi, explained this Dharma discourse, the number of sons of the gods who attained the stainless and immaculate Dharma eye with regard to phenomena was beyond the number of grains of sand in countless, limitless, and immeasurable Ganges Rivers.

original: dge slong dang / dge slong ma dang / dge bsnyen dang / dge bsnyen ma dang / lha dang / klu dang / gnod sbyin dang / dri za dang / lha ma yin dang / nam mkha' lding dang / mi 'am ci dang / lto 'phye chen po dang /
analyzed: dge slong dang / dge slong ma dang / dge bsnyen dang / dge bsnyen ma dang / lha dang / klu dang / gnod sbyin dang / dri za dang / lha ma yin dang / nam mkha' lding dang / mi 'am ci dang / lto 'phye chen po dang /
translated: The number of monks, nuns, male and female lay followers, gods, nāgas, yakṣas, gandharvas, asuras, garuḍas, kinnaras, mahoragas,

original: mi dang / mi ma yin pa rab tu mang po dag ni /
analyzed: mi dang / mi ma yin pa rab tu mang po dag ni /
translated: humans, and non-humans

original: mi skye @329b ba'i chos la bzod pa thob par gyur to //
analyzed: mi skye @329b ba'i chos la bzod pa thob par gyur to //
translated: who attained acceptance of the fact that phenomena are not produced was even greater.

original: de bas kyang ches mang ba'i sems can rnams ni /
analyzed: de bas kyang ches mang ba'i sems can rnams ni /
translated: Even more numerous were the sentient beings who

original: phyir mi ldog pa nyid du bya ba'i phyir bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu sems skyes so //
analyzed: phyir mi ldog pa nyid du bya ba'i phyir bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu sems skyes so //
translated: and the thought of unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening arose for the sake of irreversibility.

original: stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten gyi khams 'di dang / de ma yin pa sangs rgyas kyi zhing gzhan dpag tu med cing grangs med la brjod du med pa'i yang brjod du med pa dag kyang rnam pa drug tu g-yos so //
analyzed: stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten gyi khams 'di dang / de ma yin pa sangs rgyas kyi zhing gzhan dpag tu med cing grangs med la brjod du med pa'i yang brjod du med pa dag kyang rnam pa drug tu g-yos so //
translated: This trichiliocosm and other buddha-fields beyond measure, number, and expression shook in six ways.

original: gsang ba pa'i bdag po lag na rdo rje la yang chos kyi dgab pa dang / mchod pa'i phyir nam mkha'i dkyil na rnga rnams ma brdungs par kun nas sgra byung ngo //
analyzed: gsang ba pa'i bdag po lag na rdo rje la yang chos kyi dgab pa dang / mchod pa'i phyir nam mkha'i dkyil na rnga rnams ma brdungs par kun nas sgra byung ngo //
translated: And in the sky above the Lord of Secrets Vajrapāṇi, drums resounded without being played as a Dharma covering and an offering.

original: byang chub sems dpa'i rdzu 'phrul gyi gzhal med khang gi khang pa brtsegs pa rnams su kun nas sil snyan dang / pheg rdob pa dang / glu dbyangs blangs pas lha'i bu mo rnams gar byed do //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i rdzu 'phrul gyi gzhal med khang gi khang pa brtsegs pa rnams su kun nas sil snyan dang / pheg rdob pa dang / glu dbyangs blangs pas lha'i bu mo rnams gar byed do //
translated: In the kūṭāgāras of the bodhisattvas’ miraculous palaces, musical instruments and cymbals were played and songs were sung, and the daughters of the gods danced.

original: spos dang / byug pa dang / bdug pa dang / phye ma dang / gos dang / gdugs dang / rgyal mtshan dang / ba dan dang / dpag bsam gyi shing ljon pa dang / rin po che dang / mu tig gi rgyan phreng dang /
analyzed: spos dang / byug pa dang / bdug pa dang / phye ma dang / gos dang / gdugs dang / rgyal mtshan dang / ba dan dang / dpag bsam gyi shing ljon pa dang / rin po che dang / mu tig gi rgyan phreng dang /
translated: incense, ointments, perfumes, powders, clothes, parasols, victory banners, flags, wish-fulfilling trees, precious ornaments, garlands of pearls,

original: me tog padma dang / ku mu da dang / autpa la dang / dri mchog dang / sna ma'i me tog dang / pa ri sha ka dang / pa ri sha ka chen po dang / btang bzung dang / btang bzung chen po dang / mand'a ra ba dang /
analyzed: me tog padma dang / ku mu da dang / autpa la dang / dri mchog dang / sna ma'i me tog dang / pa ri sha ka dang / pa ri sha ka chen po dang / btang bzung dang / btang bzung chen po dang / mand'a ra ba dang /
translated: flowers of the lotus, the kumuda, the utpala, the jasmine, the champak, the great champak, the flower of the great champak, the mandāra,

original: mand'a ra ba chen po dang / manydzu sha ka dang / manydzu sha ka chen @330a *//
analyzed: mand'a ra ba chen po dang / manydzu sha ka dang / manydzu sha ka chen @330a *//
translated: the great mandāra, the mañjūṣaka, the great mañjūṣaka, the sammūṣaka, and the great sammūṣaka.

original: po dang / kun nas skyes dang / kun nas skyes chen po'i me tog gi char gyi sprin kun nas mngon par bab bo //
analyzed: po dang / kun nas skyes dang / kun nas skyes chen po'i me tog gi char gyi sprin kun nas mngon par bab bo //
translated: A rain cloud of flowers fell all around.

original: spos chu'i char gyi sprin yang mngon par bab bo; ;de nas tshangs pa dang / khyab 'jug dang / dbang phyug chen po dang / brgya byin dang / 'jig rten skyong ba dang / gnod sbyin dang / nam mkha' lding dang / mi 'am ci dang /
analyzed: spos chu'i char gyi sprin yang mngon par bab bo; ;de nas tshangs pa dang / khyab 'jug dang / dbang phyug chen po dang / brgya byin dang / 'jig rten skyong ba dang / gnod sbyin dang / nam mkha' lding dang / mi 'am ci dang /
translated: Then Brahmā, Viṣṇu, Maheśvara, Śakra, the world guardians, yakṣas, garuḍas, kinnaras,

original: lto 'phye chen po dang / ma mo'i gdon gyi tshogs dang / 'byung po dang / brjed byed dang / skem byed dang / sgrub pa dang / sbrul 'dzin bcas dang / gnon po dang / ma mo dang / yi dvags dang / sha za dang /
analyzed: lto 'phye chen po dang / ma mo'i gdon gyi tshogs dang / 'byung po dang / brjed byed dang / skem byed dang / sgrub pa dang / sbrul 'dzin bcas dang / gnon po dang / ma mo dang / yi dvags dang / sha za dang /
translated: mahoragas, the hosts of mātṛkā spirits, bhūtas, apasmāras, kaśmalas, sādhyas, upajahkas, pūtanas, mātṛs, pretas, piśācas,

original: bram ze'i srin po dang / mkha' 'gro ma dang / phyogs dang / phyogs mtshams dang / mkhar dang / ri dang / sa'i lha la sogs pa sdang ba gdon bgegs dang / log 'dren thams cad dang / de ma yin pa gzhan yang lha dang /
analyzed: bram ze'i srin po dang / mkha' 'gro ma dang / phyogs dang / phyogs mtshams dang / mkhar dang / ri dang / sa'i lha la sogs pa sdang ba gdon bgegs dang / log 'dren thams cad dang / de ma yin pa gzhan yang lha dang /
translated: rākṣasas, ḍākinīs, the directions, the intermediate directions, the mountains, the earth gods, and so forth—all the hostile spirits, obstructors, and misleaders, and also other gods,

original: mi dang / mi ma yin pa dag bla gos rnams phrag pa gcig tu gzar te pus mo g-yas pa'i lha nga sa la btsugs nas bcom ldan 'das ga la ba de logs su thal mo sbyar ba btud de bcom ldan 'das la 'di skad ces gsol to; ;bcom ldan 'das
analyzed: mi dang / mi ma yin pa dag bla gos rnams phrag pa gcig tu gzar te pus mo g-yas pa'i lha nga sa la btsugs nas bcom ldan 'das ga la ba de logs su thal mo sbyar ba btud de bcom ldan 'das la 'di skad ces gsol to; ;bcom ldan 'das
translated: “Blessed One,

original: / gang gis bdag cag gzir cing nye bar gzir bas rig sngags 'chang thams cad la dngos grub stsol ba dang / dam tshig thams cad @330b 'dzin du 'jug pa la yang dag par gnang bar bgyid par 'gyur ba rang gi snying po 'di bdag cag la bstan du gsol /
analyzed: / gang gis bdag cag gzir cing nye bar gzir bas rig sngags 'chang thams cad la dngos grub stsol ba dang / dam tshig thams cad @330b 'dzin du 'jug pa la yang dag par gnang bar bgyid par 'gyur ba rang gi snying po 'di bdag cag la bstan du gsol /
translated: please teach us our own essence, by which we will be tormented and oppressed, and will grant spiritual powers to all vidyādhara-s, and will be authorized to engage in all commitments.”

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis tshangs pa la sogs pa lha'i tshogs de dag la legs so zhes bya ba byin te /
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis tshangs pa la sogs pa lha'i tshogs de dag la legs so zhes bya ba byin te /
translated: Then the Blessed One gave his approval to those hosts of gods such as Brahmā, saying, “Excellent!

original: grogs po dag /
analyzed: grogs po dag /
translated: Friends,

original: gang gi phyir khyed cag 'di ltar sems can thams cad la phan pa'i phyir zhugs pa ni /
analyzed: gang gi phyir khyed cag 'di ltar sems can thams cad la phan pa'i phyir zhugs pa ni /
translated: it is excellent that you have thus engaged for the benefit of all sentient beings.

original: legs so legs so //
analyzed: legs so legs so //
translated: Excellent, excellent!

original: de'i phyir legs par rab tu nyon la yid la zungs shig dang / ngas khyed rang rang gi snying po bstan par bya'o //🔽de dag gis kyang bcom ldan 'das la legs so legs so //
analyzed: de'i phyir legs par rab tu nyon la yid la zungs shig dang / ngas khyed rang rang gi snying po bstan par bya'o // de dag gis kyang bcom ldan 'das la legs so legs so //
translated: Therefore, listen well and keep it in mind, and I will teach you your own essence.

original: zhes gsol to //
analyzed: zhes gsol to //
translated: They also said to the Bhagavān, “Excellent, excellent!”

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis lha'i rnga bo che dang / rgya mtsho dang / sprin chen po'i sgra lta bu'i gsung tshangs pa chen po'i sgra bas lhag pa sna tshogs pa snyan cing rgya che la zab pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis lha'i rnga bo che dang / rgya mtsho dang / sprin chen po'i sgra lta bu'i gsung tshangs pa chen po'i sgra bas lhag pa sna tshogs pa snyan cing rgya che la zab pa /
translated: The Bhagavān’s voice was like the sound of a great divine drum, the ocean, and a great cloud. It was greater than the sound of Brahmā, various, pleasant, vast, and deep.

original: thog ma dang / bar dang / tha mar dge ba /
analyzed: thog ma dang / bar dang / tha mar dge ba /
translated: It was virtuous in the beginning, middle, and end.

original: sems can thams cad kyi snying du 'thad pa /
analyzed: sems can thams cad kyi snying du 'thad pa /
translated: It was agreeable to the hearts of all sentient beings.

original: gsal ba / 'jebs pa /
analyzed: gsal ba / 'jebs pa /
translated: It was clear, delicious,

original: dag pa / mnyen pa /
analyzed: dag pa / mnyen pa /
translated: pure, and soft.

original: snyan pa / brjod pa'i tshig khams gsum pa thams cad la go bar byed pa /
analyzed: snyan pa / brjod pa'i tshig khams gsum pa thams cad la go bar byed pa /
translated: It was pleasant, and the words were understood in all three realms.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i seng+ge'i sgra bla na med pa des grub pa'i gsang sngags kyi gzhi 'di dag gsungs so //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i seng+ge'i sgra bla na med pa des grub pa'i gsang sngags kyi gzhi 'di dag gsungs so //

analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas thams cad la phyag 'tshal lo //

analyzed: he he badzra p'a ni / hi hi hi hi / he he he he / badzra p'a ni / ka la ka la / ba la ba la; ra la ra la / dha ma dha ma / sa ra sa ra / h'a h'a h'a h'a h'a / tsi li mi li / tshi le di le / di di la / di mi le / dzva le / ma h'a dzva le / dzva li ti / pra dzva li ti / tha ra tha ga ge tha re / mu ku ti; ksha me / ksha ma me / grub pa'i tshogs kyis phyag byas ma / lha thams cad kyi snying kun tu 'jug par byed ma / sems can thams cad kyi snying 'bigs ma / sdang ba rab tu sdang ba thams cad kyi snying 'joms ma / de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi snying po rjes su skyong ma /
translated: He he vajrapani!🔽Hi hi hi hi!🔽He he he he!🔽Vajrapani!🔽Kala kala!🔽Bhava bhava!🔽Rala rala!🔽Dhama dhama!🔽Sara sara!🔽Hā hā hā hā hā!🔽Cili mili!🔽Tsile dile!🔽Dila dila!🔽Dimi le!🔽Jvale!🔽Mahājvale!🔽Jvalita!🔽Prajvalita!🔽Taratarage tara re!🔽Mukuta!🔽Kṣame!🔽Kṣamāme!🔽Homage to the assembly of siddhas!🔽Pervader of the hearts of all gods!🔽Piercer of the hearts of all beings!🔽Destroyer of the hearts of all who are hostile and very hostile!🔽Protector of the essence of all tathāgatas!🔽

original: sems can thams cad kyi snying rnams khug la dam tshig la khod cig /
analyzed: sems can thams cad kyi snying rnams khug la dam tshig la khod cig /
translated: Take the hearts of all sentient beings and bind them to their commitments!

original: thams cad mkhyen pa la phyag 'tshal @331b lo sv'ah'a; 'jig rten mkhyen pa thams cad la phyag 'tshal lo sv'ah'a /
analyzed: thams cad mkhyen pa la phyag 'tshal @331b lo sv'ah'a; 'jig rten mkhyen pa thams cad la phyag 'tshal lo sv'ah'a /

original: tra ta tra ta /
analyzed: tra ta tra ta /

original: spho ta ya sv'ah'a /🔽gyen du lta la sv'ah'a /
analyzed: spho ta ya sv'ah'a / gyen du lta la sv'ah'a /

original: rnam par lta la sv'ah'a /
analyzed: rnam par lta la sv'ah'a /
translated: To the one who looks all around, svāhā!

original: chu srin la sv'ah'a /
analyzed: chu srin la sv'ah'a /
translated: To the crocodile, svāhā!

original: me la sv'ah'a /
analyzed: me la sv'ah'a /
translated: To the fire, svāhā!

original: tshangs pa la sv'ah'a; khyab 'jug la sv'ah'a /
analyzed: tshangs pa la sv'ah'a; khyab 'jug la sv'ah'a /
